description: Black voters are more disconnected from the Democratic Party than they have been in decades, frustrated with what many see as inaction on their political priorities and unhappy with President Biden, a candidate they helped lift to the White House just three years ago.

title: Do You Know These Military-Themed Books That Became Movies?
description: With Veterans Day coming up, heres short quiz that tests your knowledge on the film adaptations of books about those who served.

title: The Easiest Chicken Noodle Soup for the Busiest Season
description: A nasty bug took up residence in our house recently, felling us all for a miserable few days. Boy were we grateful for the miracle nutrition of Alexa Weibels easiest chicken noodle soup!

title: Were These Artworks Looted? After Seizures and Lawsuits, Some Still Debate
description: For decades, several important museums and collectors ignored suggestions that the works they owned by the Austrian master Egon Schiele had been stolen by the Nazis from a Viennese cabaret performer, Fritz Grnbaum.

title: In Food, Geoff Sobelle Explores the Extremes of Eating
description: It was a little before 6:30 on a recent weeknight, and the kitchen in Geoff Sobelles West Village home was in chaos. Two toddlers zoomed around on a ride-on truck and begged him to read from an Alice in Wonderland pop-up book. In a minute, Sobelle told his son as he stirred artichokes that were simmering on the stove. All the while, he talked to a reporter about his solo show, Food, which is running as part of the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Next Wave festival through Nov. 18.

title: The Times/Siena Poll Isnt the Only One Indicating an Unhappy Electorate
description: With the 2024 election one year away, The New York Times/Siena College polls released Sunday combined with surveys from two other organizations showed a consistent picture: a deeply unhappy electorate dissatisfied with both of its main options and offering warning signs for President Biden.

title: Polands Art World Awaits a Culture War Counteroffensive
description: Just weeks after becoming Polands culture minister, in 2015, Piotr Glinski began a yearslong effort to shift his countrys cultural life toward the political right.

title: Filipino Radio Journalist Fatally Shot During Live Broadcast
description: A Filipino radio journalist, Juan Jumalon, was shot and killed during a live broadcast at his home in the southwest Philippines early on Sunday, according to the local authorities, who were searching for possibly multiple attackers.

title: Five Wounded as Russian Missiles Strike Odesa, Damaging an Art Museum
description: A day after Ukraine damaged a Russian naval vessel in an airstrike on Crimea, Russia hit the southern Ukrainian city of Odesa with missiles and drones, injuring five people and damaging an art museum founded in the 19th century, local and military authorities said Monday.

title: Boy George Will Join Moulin Rouge! on Broadway in 2024
description: The British pop star Boy George will play the role of the enthusiastic club owner Harold Zidler in Moulin Rouge! The Musical next year, returning to Broadway for the first time in two decades.

title: How Do You Use Checks? And Do They Work Well for You?
description: Fewer people are writing paper checks these days, and for banks thats a good thing. With check fraud on the rise, banks prefer other forms of payment.

title: At 50, the Kronos Quartet Is Still Playing for the Future
description: Late one night in 1973, a young violinist named David Harrington was listening to the radio. He heard some music that was just a few years old: George Crumbs Black Angels, a harsh and eerie, prayerful and screaming piece for amplified string quartet, full of grief and anger about the quagmire in Vietnam.

title: Whitney Wolfe Herd Is Stepping Down as Bumbles C.E.O. After a Decade
description: Whitney Wolfe Herd, who founded the women-centered dating app Bumble a decade ago, is stepping down and will be replaced by Lidiane Jones, the chief executive of the workplace-messaging platform Slack, Bumble said on Monday.

title: After Two Years in Solitude, Britains Loneliest Sheep Finds a Home
description: Fiona, a now-famous and once-lonely British sheep, is at the center of a social media frenzy as well as a local dispute.

title: Man Whose Son Is Accused of Parade Shooting Pleads Guilty to Misdemeanors
description: Robert Crimo Jr. knew that his young son had threatened violence in the family home, promising to kill everyone, prosecutors said. The son, Robert Crimo III, had expressed interest in committing a mass shooting in an exchange with a camp counselor and later sent text messages suggesting that he wanted to end his own life.

title: Could a Prominent Democrat Really Challenge Biden? Its Unlikely, at This Point.
description: Forty-four years ago tomorrow, the last serious primary opponent to a sitting Democratic president announced his campaign before 5,000 supporters in Boston.

title: At Paul Taylor, a Drum Circle and a Fierce Sisterhood
description: When designing sets for the choreographer Paul Taylor, the artist Alex Katz had a habit he called killing the center. Katz would stick obstacles in the middle of the stage  fake boulders, a bunch of mirrors, cutouts of dogs  to deny Taylor the easy power of that theatrical focal point. Taylor always rose to the creative challenge.

title: Inside the Courtroom at Trumps Fraud Trial
description: Donald J. Trump began his testimony Monday before a packed Manhattan courtroom, filled with onlookers. They had come to witness the spectacle of a former U.S. president taking the witness stand at trial to defend his family business and his reputation as a real estate mogul.

title: With Poll Results Favoring Trump, Should Biden Step Aside?
description: To the Editor:

title: Blinken Warns Iran Against Widening the Conflict Between Israel and Hamas
description: If Iran had any doubts about American resolve in the Middle East, Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken, with an assist from the Pentagon, spent the weekend reinforcing the notion that the United States was not going anywhere.

title: A Knock at the Door
description: We dont like having to do this, believe me, the uniformed man at the door said in a tone that implied he had no strong feelings about it one way or the other. Well try to get it over with quick.

title: The Trumps Seven Springs estate has carried very different values over the years.
description: Former President Donald J. Trump testified on Monday that he had lowered the value of one of his properties  the sprawling Seven Springs estate in New York Citys northern suburbs  because he thought it was too high.

title: OpenAI Lets Mom-and-Pop Shops Customize ChatGPT
description: OpenAI said on Monday that it had created a service that allows individuals and small businesses to build customized versions of its popular online chatbot, ChatGPT, and instantly share them on the internet.

title: Zdenek Macal, Conductor With an International Reach, Dies at 87
description: Zdenek Macal, a Czech-born conductor who drew a distinctively rich and full sound from orchestras in several countries, including the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra, where his tenure is regarded by musicians and administrators as something of a golden age, died on Oct. 25 in Prague. He was 87.

title: Frankies 457 Sicilian Olive Oils for Drizzling Over Everything
description: Frank Falcinelli and Frank Castronovo, the owners of Frankies 457 in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, also happen to have a piece of the Asaro Family Farm, in the Belice Valley in southwest Sicily. The Franks have added some new products bearing the restaurants name. A basic everyday oil, sold by the liter, is a blend of Nocellara del Belice, Biancolilla and hearty Cerasuola olives, all Sicilian natives, golden, with a peppery edge in its finish ($27.99 for 1 liter). Then theres a Calabrian Chili Oil ($21.99 for 17 ounces), ruddy, with vibrant heat from three kinds of chiles blended into the Sicilian oil; the Franks suggest drizzling it on pizza. The organic extra virgin oil made entirely from Nocellara del Belice, greener and more herbal ($34.99 for 17 ounces), has been on the market for some time and is still available. They have also introduced six traditional organic pastas made from ancient grains, cut on bronze dies and air-dried ($7.49 a pound), and deliciously meaty Castelvetrano olives and whole Sicilian black (brownish) olives, each $8.49 for 12 ounces.

title: U.N. Says Israel-Gaza War Is Deadliest Ever for Its Personnel
description: The United Nations secretary general, Antnio Guterres, said on Monday that 89 employees of the U.N. agency aiding Palestinian refugees, known as UNRWA, had been killed in Gaza in the month of war between Israel and Hamas.

title: Cody Dorman, Who Forged a Close Bond With a Top Racehorse, Dies at 17
description: Cody Dorman, who inspired the name of the racehorse Codys Wish, died on Sunday, a day after the horse won at the Breeders Cup in Southern California. He was 17.

title: Investigators Head to Antarctica Research Base After Claims of Sexual Violence
description: The independent monitor for the National Science Foundation is sending investigators to McMurdo Station in Antarctica who should arrive on Monday after a report last year raised concerns about sexual assault and harassment at a U.S. research base.

title: How Democrats Lost Voters With a Compensate Losers Strategy
description: A lot of Democrats are bewildered by why their party isnt doing better in campaigns against a Republican Party that is deeply dysfunctional. A new paper by three economists proposes a fresh explanation that seems persuasive to me. It says the Democrats went astray right around  1976.

title: Male-Killing Virus Is Discovered in Insects
description: Scientists in Japan have identified a virus that selectively kills males  and it happens to be inheritable, creating generation upon generation of all females.

title: Trumps lawyers in the case have different approaches to representing the former president.
description: Christopher M. Kise and Alina Habba, the two lawyers who joined Donald J. Trump at the defense table before he testified Monday at his civil fraud trial in New York, represent different aspects of what the former president looks for in a defender.

title: The State Department Approves $320 Million Sale of Guided Bomb Equipment to Israel
description: The U.S. State Department has approved a $320 million sale to Israel of equipment for kits that turn unguided bombs into more precise, GPS-guided munitions, according to a letter sent by the department to Congress that was obtained by The New York Times.

title: Imprisoned Nobel Winner and Iranian Rights Activist Begins a Hunger Strike
description: Narges Mohammadi, the imprisoned Iranian human rights activist who won this years Nobel Peace Prize, began a hunger strike on Monday, after she was denied hospital treatment for two blocked coronary arteries, her family said.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Israel Cuts the Gaza Strip in Two
description: Israels military said yesterday that it had encircled Gaza City, effectively splitting the Gaza Strip in half. Israel said the move would make it harder for Hamas to retain control of the area.

title: When a Child Is Shot, Trauma Ripples Through Families, Study Finds
description: With each mass shooting, Americans look to one grim indicator  the number of dead  as a measure of the destructive impact. But damage left behind by gunshot wounds reverberates among survivors and families, sending mental health disorders soaring and shifting huge burdens onto the health care system, a new analysis of private health insurance claims shows.

title: Biden Administration, After Setbacks, Talks Up Renewable Power Gains
description: The Biden administration announced on Monday progress on 15 large renewable energy projects, an apparent effort to project confidence in an industry that is facing steep challenges.

title: Young Men Seek Answers to an Age-Old Question: How to Be Hot
description: Skin-care routines, hair care, a good nights sleep: These are not cutting-edge suggestions for how to look ones best, at least not for anyone who has ever consulted a womens magazine.

title: Biden Announces New Investments in Passenger Rail Projects
description: President Biden, perhaps Amtraks most famous advocate, announced $16.4 billion in funding for rail projects on Monday, exhibiting a business-as-usual approach as polls show him trailing former President Donald J. Trump one year before Election Day.

title: Review: In This 120 Days of Sodom, Sadism Stands in the Way
description: Is anything even shocking on a stage anymore? Simulated rape, coprophilia and torture all feature heavily in Milo Raus The Last Generation, or the 120 Days of Sodom, a theater production starring actors with Down syndrome that opened Saturday at the Thtre de Lige, in Belgium.

title: A Judge Tries to Do What Few Have Accomplished: Rein in Trump
description: On the first day of Donald J. Trumps testimony in Manhattan, the judge presiding over the civil fraud case against the former president tried to do what Hillary Clinton, a star-studded lineup of debate moderators and even Mr. Trumps own lawyers could not: make Mr. Trump stop talking.

title: Four Men Charged in the Case of the Missing Golden Toilet
description: Four years ago, a fully functioning 18-karat gold toilet was stolen from an art exhibition at Blenheim Palace, the birthplace of Winston Churchill.

title: Second Police Officer Acquitted in Elijah McClain Death
description: A second Colorado police officer has been acquitted in the 2019 death of Elijah McClain, a young, unarmed Black man whose case attracted national attention and became central to debates about police brutality and race.

title: Trump Testified at His New York Civil Fraud Trial
description: During four hours of testimony in a Manhattan courtroom today, Donald Trump repeatedly attacked the judge overseeing the trial and defended himself against accusations of fraudulently misvaluing his properties.

title: Weekly Student News Quiz: Birds, Baseball, Bankman-Fried
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: China Is Lending Billions to Countries in Financial Trouble
description: After lending $1.3 trillion to developing countries, mainly for big-ticket infrastructure projects, China has shifted its focus to bailing out many of those same countries from piles of debt.

title: Democrats in Congress Weigh Calls for Cease-Fire Amid Pressure From the Left
description: Democrats in Congress, torn between their support for Israel in its war with Hamas and concern about civilian suffering in Gaza, are struggling with how far to go in calling for measures to mitigate civilian casualties as the left wing of the party escalates pressure for a cease-fire.

title: The Statue of Liberty Is the Setting for an Israel-Hamas War Protest
description: Hundreds of protesters boarded ferries to the Statue of Liberty on Monday, carrying banners calling for a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war that they unfurled from the statues pedestal.

title: Prosecutors Assail Trumps Bid to Have Federal Election Case Dismissed
description: Federal prosecutors on Monday asked a judge to reject a barrage of motions filed last month by former President Donald J. Trump that sought to toss out the indictment charging him with plotting to overturn the 2020 election and said his claims were full of distortions and misrepresentations.

title: Why Does the Right Hate America?
description: U.S. democracy is clearly in crisis. Its entirely possible that in less than two years dissenters will face the power of a government with an authoritarian bent; if that sounds to you like hyperbole, you arent paying attention.

title: DeSantis Lands a Big Endorsement: Kim Reynolds, Iowas Popular Governor
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida needed a lift in his quest to beat former President Donald J. Trump in the crucial Iowa caucuses.

title: Biden Confronts the Limits of U.S. Leverage in Two Conflicts
description: After four weeks of terror and retaliation in Israel and Gaza, and 20 months of war in Ukraine, President Biden is confronting the limits of his leverage in the two international conflicts defining his presidency.

title: Gaza Death Toll Has Hit 10,000, Its Health Ministry Says
description: In just under a month, Israeli strikes have killed more than 10,000 people in Gaza and injured more than 25,000 others, the Gaza Health Ministry said on Monday.

title: Excerpts From Nashville School Shooters Writings Are Published Online
description: A conservative political commentator published three photographs on Monday that appeared to show excerpts from writings by the shooter who killed six people at a Nashville Christian school, enraging parents of the surviving students and prompting an investigation into the leak.

title: Heres Who Qualified for the Third Republican Presidential Debate
description: Five candidates have qualified for the third Republican presidential debate on Wednesday evening, the Republican National Committee announced on Monday.

title: Flaco the Owl, Zoo Escapee, Leaves Central Park for the East Village
description: Flaco the Eurasian eagle-owl, whose February escape from the Central Park Zoo captured the publics attention in New York and beyond, turned up in Manhattans East Village on Monday, about five miles from the wooded park area he had settled into since flying free.

title: WeWork Files for Bankruptcy Amid Glut of Empty Offices
description: WeWork, the real estate company that offered start-ups and individuals sleek quarters to pursue their entrepreneurial dreams, filed for bankruptcy protection in the United States on Monday after years of struggling to find its footing.

title: Conditions
description: Jump to: Todays Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Florida Dentist Convicted in Murder-for-Hire Plot Against Law Professor
description: For nearly a decade, the sensational killing of a prominent Florida law professor in 2014 centered on a single, sordid question: Did his ex-wifes family, motivated by an ugly custody dispute, hire hit men to murder him?

title: Corrections: Nov. 7, 2023
description: A quotation highlighted in an article on Sunday about injuries suffered by U.S. troops who  fired vast numbers of artillery rounds against the Islamic State misidentified the speaker, a former gunner who killed a man during a psychotic episode. It was Brady Zipoy,  not Austin Powell.

title: Quotation of the Day: Amid Mideast Violence, Food Cant Offer a Route to Peace
description: We have this romantic idea that if we eat the same food and break the same bread somehow we can come together, but that doesnt seem to be the case here.

title: Israel Says It Has Split Gaza Strip in Two in Drive to Isolate Hamass Leadership
description: The Israeli military said its forces had split the Gaza Strip in two after a night of heavy airstrikes, a move that Israel said would make it more difficult for Hamas to control the enclave.

title: Jewish Mans Death After California Protest Clash Is Under Investigation
description: As a fatal clash between suburban protesters in Southern California threatened to become an international incident on Tuesday, the authorities said that it wasnt exactly crystal clear how a 69-year-old Jewish man died from an altercation with a pro-Palestinian demonstrator over the weekend.

title: Virginia: How to Vote, Where to Vote and Whats on the Ballot
description: [Heres how to vote in Ohio, New York, New Jersey, Mississippi, and Kentucky.]

description: [Heres how to vote in New Jersey, New York, Mississippi, Kentucky, and Virginia.]

title: Its Election Day in New York: Heres What to Know
description: [Heres how to vote in New Jersey, Ohio, Mississippi, Kentucky, and Virginia.]

title: Her Name Is Barbra, but It Wasnt Always
description: Hello, enormous.

title: Brazil Cracks Down on Surprising New Threat: Neo-Nazis
description: In southern Brazil in July, Laureano Toscani and Joo Guilherme Correa were smoking cigarettes along a busy road in their prison-issued garb, shorts and sandals, waiting for a ride after seven months in jail.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: Nearly a month after Israel began its bombardment of Gaza, the territorys Hamas-run health ministry said more than 10,000 people had been killed and more than 25,000 injured. The figures could not be independently verified, but a Pentagon spokesman said that we know the numbers are in the thousands.

title: Im a Ukrainian, and I Refuse to Compete for Your Attention
description: The day Hamas attacked Israel, I unexpectedly reunited with my best friend in Kyiv.

title: Vortenses and the Storms of Space-Time
description: If you have ever wondered what it might feel like to be sucked into a black hole  twisted, stretched, confused, doomed  you could do worse than trip through The Warped Side of Our Universe, An Odyssey Through Black Holes, Wormholes, Time Travel and Gravitational Waves, a collaborative book project by Kip Thorne, a physicist at the California Institute of Technology, and Lia Halloran, a visual artist and chair of the art department at Chapman University in Orange, Calif.

title: California Boat Captain Convicted of Manslaughter in Fire That Killed 34
description: The captain of a dive boat that caught fire off the coast of Southern California in 2019, killing all 33 passengers and one of its six crew members, was found guilty by a federal jury on Monday on one count of an offense known as seamans manslaughter.

title: Word of the Day: onus
description: The word onus has appeared in 83 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Sept. 23 in the Opinion essay Were Teaching Music to Kids All Wrong by Sammy Miller:

title: Late Night Riffs on Trumps Lead Over Biden in Early Poll
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: King Charles III, Climate Advocate, Delivers Speech at Odds With His Beliefs
description: For a lifelong supporter of environmental causes, a plan to expand oil and gas drilling in the North Sea was probably not what King Charles III had hoped to announce when he opened Britains Parliament for the first time as monarch.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

title: Time Change
description: Sunday marked the end of Daylight Saving Time, where, in some parts of the world, including the United States, people set their clocks back an hour.

title: N.F.L. Fans, Take a Number for Your Teams Chances
description: There are some drawbacks to being a Minnesota Vikings fan, said Kevin Quealy, editor of The Upshot, The New York Timess data-driven site about politics, economics and everyday life. His team has never won the Super Bowl, and just trying to calculate their playoff odds can become a headache. Even sportscasters appear to be run ragged by the probabilities.

title: 5 Things We Learned During Trumps Trial Testimony
description: Donald J. Trump took the witness stand on Monday in a packed New York courtroom in a trial that threatens the business empire underpinning his public persona as he kicks off another run for the White House.

title: Does Anyone Know How to Behave on the Subway Anymore?
description: There are unwritten rules when riding the New York City subway.

title: From Substance to Shouting: The Demise of Political Debate in America
description: Presidential debates werent always so hostile.

title: Grave Robbers of the Wild West
description: Archaeology in its formative years was often less a meticulous science than an exercise in vandalism.

title: In The Future, Earth Barrels Toward Fiery Destruction
description: There are few figures in the Bible more cruelly evocative than Lots wife, who is transfigured into a pillar of salt for looking back at Sodom. The poet Anna Akhmatova mourned her swift legs rooted to the ground; Kurt Vonnegut wrote of her backward glance, I love her for that, because it was so human. Naomi Aldermans The Future, like much great science fiction, turns the symbolic into tangible, chemical reality. Early in her novel, a woman is frozen to death with a chemical refrigerant made of paramagnetic salts: a Lots wife for the Information Age.

title: He Believes Hes Been Reincarnated. Heres His Tale of Life, Love and Fate.
description: It is the most beautiful of all possible worlds, a chapter heading proclaims at the beginning of Jonathan Evisons new novel, Again and Again. But its easy to doubt this cheerful echo of Candide as we are introduced to the books protagonist, Eugene Miles, a centenarian curmudgeon living in an elder-care facility in the California desert who insists  a bit too loudly and often  on his desire to be left alone to await death.

title: Setting a Table for the Holidays? Designers Share Their Secrets.
description: Serving a meal is about more than just feeding your guests.

title: Gazing Into the Past and Future at Historic Observatories
description: At the top of Mount Hamilton, near San Jose, Calif., Lick Observatory looks out over the dense sprawl of the San Francisco Bay Area. On a clear day from the 4,200-foot summit, you can see San Francisco to the north, as well as the entrance to Yosemite Valley, 120 miles east, as the crow flies. At night you can see even farther  millions of light-years into space.

title: I Just Got Over Covid but Still Feel Awful
description: Q: Its been a week since I tested negative for Covid, but I dont feel totally better. Why am I still sick?

title: Desire Mareas Genre-Melting Music Stirs South Africa, and the World
description: On a crisp Thursday morning hours before Desire Mareas performance at the Transform Festival in Leeds, England, earlier this month, the South African songwriter sat in Kirkstall Valley Nature Reserve, communing with his Zulu ancestors. Its a practice he honed through his training as a sangoma, a traditional spiritual healer, and it is essential to his craft.

title: How the Humble Sheet Cake Became Top Tier
description: The Los Angeles-based baker Michelle Boulos can still picture the sheet cakes she ate as a child: slathered with bright white frosting, decorated with tiny plastic balloons. But the confections she makes and sells via her Instagram account No Good Cakes are something else entirely. On one recent creation, frills of buttercream surrounded an acid green ombr surface inspired by a chemical spill. On another, foraged blooms sprouted from bronze-colored barnacles, some of them embedded with tiny light bulbs. Boulos, 34, started baking the fantastical cakes out of her home in 2022 after making one for a wedding. I got bitten by the sheet cake bug, she says. It can be so versatile but also really complex.

title: Why Palestinians Feel Theyve Been Duped
description: Before there can be any kind of stable coexistence of Israelis and Palestinians, there will have to be a stable coexistence of narratives. And thats what well be attempting this week on the show: to look at both the present and the past through Israeli and Palestinian perspectives. The point is not to choose between them. The point is to really listen to them. Even  especially  when whats being said is hard for us to hear.

title: Winter Accessories That Sparkle and Shine
A Wood-Lined Retreat in the Heart of Paris
description: IN THE CENTER of Paris, in the First Arrondissement, around the corner from the Jardin du Palais-Royal  with its orderly tree-lined promenades theres a ragged bistro called Juveniles at which tourists jostle for tables and locals buy bottles of wine to bring home after work. Its a true neighborhood spot in an office-dominated district where most Parisians could never imagine living, even if they wanted to: Nearby are the Louvre, the Opra Garnier, Sainte-Chapelle and other landmarks so intrinsic to the grand cinematic vision of the city that the relatively few apartments that become available around here are almost immediately snatched up.

title: Hungry (but Not for Human Contact), Americans Head for the Drive-Through
description: Faith Enokian loves a drive-through. The senior at the University of South Alabama loves them so much she pulls into one at least eight times a week.

title: Why Salmonella Makes So Many People Sick
description: Cantaloupe, diced onions, cookie dough, alfalfa sprouts, peanut butter  what do these very different foods have in common?

title: Did a 2008 Rule Change Ruin Presidential Debates?
description: Sophomoric insults. Rudeness. Personal attacks. Cross talk.

title: How Your Childs School Bus Might Prevent Blackouts
description: The four vehicles parked at a depot in South Burlington, Vt., look no different from the yellow school buses familiar to millions of schoolchildren. But beneath their steel shells, these buses are packed with technology that could be vital in the transition to clean energy.

title: Should Schools Ban Cellphones?
description: Nearly one in four countries has laws or policies banning or restricting student cellphone use in schools.

title: Lavish Tax Credits and Trade Protections Lure Solar Firms to U.S.
description: Six years ago, an executive from Suniva, a bankrupt solar panel manufacturer, warned a packed hearing room in Washington that competition from companies in China and Southeast Asia was causing a blood bath in his industry. More than 30 U.S.-based solar companies had been forced to shut down in the previous five years alone, he said, and others would soon follow unless the government supported them.

title: Whats Behind Kennedys Poll Numbers? Voters Dread a Trump-Biden Rematch.
description: A looming rematch next year between President Biden and former President Donald J. Trump has left voters deeply dissatisfied with their options, longing for alternatives and curious about independent candidates like Robert F. Kennedy Jr., according to new polls of six battleground states conducted by The New York Times and Siena College.

title: In Regulating A.I., We May Be Doing Too Much. And Too Little.
description: When President Biden signed his sweeping executive order on artificial intelligence last week, he joked about the strange experience of watching a deep fake of himself, saying, When the hell did I say that?

title: Their Final Wish? A Burial in Space.
description: There are two ways to contemplate the question Where do we go when we die? One is philosophical, ultimately unanswerable; the other is logistical. Humans, being human, have tended to see them as being intertwined: The many traditions weve devised for handling our remains are meant to honor the selves that left those bodies behind.

title: Step 1 if Youre Going to Beat Trump
description: In the movie Back to the Future II, Michael J. Foxs character, Marty McFly, is transported to the fall of 2015 and encounters a world of self-tying shoes and hoverboards. He finds himself trying to make sense of how people behave and the choices they make.

title: Extreme Weather May Be Displacing Animals, Too, a New Study Suggests
description: A new analysis published this week suggests that extreme weather linked to climate change might be much harder on native species than on nonnative ones.

title: Thousands of Gazans fled south during a window given by Israel, the U.N. says.
description: About 5,000 people left the northern half of Gaza during a four-hour window given by the Israeli military on Monday, according to United Nations monitors, a day after Israel said its forces had cleaved the territory in two.

title: Under Scrutiny Over Gaza, Israel Points to Civilian Toll of U.S. Wars
description: Falluja. Mosul. Copenhagen. Hiroshima.

title: Where New York Stands on a Groundwater Crisis
description: Good morning. Its Tuesday. Today well see how New York is managing its groundwater amid a nationwide crisis. And, because its Election Day, well catch up on contests to watch.

title: Supreme Court Seems Likely to Uphold Law Disarming Domestic Abusers
description: The Supreme Court seemed ready on Tuesday to rule that the government may disarm people under domestic violence orders, limiting the sweep of last years blockbuster decision that vastly expanded gun rights.

title: Special Counsel Rebuts Claims of Favoritism Toward Hunter Biden
description: David C. Weiss, who negotiated an ill-fated plea deal with President Bidens son, Hunter, fiercely defended the integrity of his investigation before House Republicans on Tuesday, the first time a special counsel has fielded questions from lawmakers before concluding an inquiry.

title: Viewed Warily by Democrats, a Netanyahu Ally Is a Key Conduit to U.S.
description: When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu named Ron Dermer as Israels ambassador to the United States in 2013, aides to President Barack Obama, viewing Mr. Dermer as a right-wing political operative rather than a diplomat, discussed whether the White House should refuse to accept his credentials. (They dropped the idea.)

title: Nearing Her 109th Birthday, and Still Waiting for Her Day in Court
description: For more than a century, Lessie Benningfield Randle, one of the last known survivors of the 1921 Tulsa race massacre, has lived with the searing details of that spring. For decades, she has recalled the fire that ravaged her neighborhood, Greenwood, and the frantic trip with her grandmother to the safety of a fairground.

title: The One Audience Trump Cant Hoodwink
description: The witness stand in Justice Arthur Engorons courtroom at 60 Centre Street, in Lower Manhattan, is an ordinary wood-paneled box off to the side of the bench. But for Donald Trump, who is on trial for fraudulently overvaluing his New York real estate assets, it might as well be a cage of kryptonite.

title: A Win-Win Loophole Giving Artists Space to Create
description: On a recent afternoon, in a ground-floor retail unit in one of Londons many vacant office buildings, a pair of flame-red platform heel boots with what looked like tentacles growing out of them and a multimedia sculpture of a coffin-like object circled by plastic shark fins were on show.

title: What to Watch for in Todays Elections, and More
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you havent already, download it here  available to Times news subscribers on iOS  and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: Human Skull, On Sale for $4,000, Draws Attention to Florida Store
description: As a nod to Halloween, Beth Meyer, who owns a rock and crystal store in North Fort Myers, Fla., placed a human skull inside a glass display case there and surrounded it with quartz towers and other crystals.

title: The Growing Republican Battle Over War Funding
description: Its been one month since the attack on Israel, but Washington has yet to deliver an aid package to its closest ally. The reason has to do with a different ally, in a different war: Speaker Mike Johnson has opposed continued funding for Ukraine, and wants the issue separated from aid to Israel, setting up a clash between the House and Senate.

title: Chinas Banks and Property Sector Threaten a Growing Economy
description: The International Monetary Fund warned on Tuesday of risks posed by Chinas financial and property sectors even as it took a more optimistic view on the countrys economic growth.

title: A Guide to Election Day
description: Today is Election Day, and we are using this newsletter to give you a guide. One theme is that Democrats are hoping to continue their strong recent electoral performance despite President Bidens low approval rating.

title: Thailand hopes its hostages in Gaza will be the next to be released.
description: The foreign minister of Thailand said Tuesday that officials he had met in Qatar and Egypt indicated the Thai hostages held by Hamas and other armed groups would be the next to be released because they had nothing to do with the war.

title: Wins in Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia bolster Democrats looking for signs for next years national election.
description: Democrats looking for positive signs ahead of next years elections had reason to celebrate on Tuesday, scoring victories in off-year elections in Kentucky, Virginia and Ohio that signaled the continued strength of the partys abortion-focused campaign playbook.

title: Uber Reports Record Ridership and Second Straight Quarterly Profit
description: Uber on Tuesday reported financial results that showed its business was continuing to steadily chug along  and even turn a profit  as more riders and drivers used its platform than ever before.

title: Is Homer Simpson a Good Dad Now?
description: Homer Simpson may be maturing, or so he says.

title: Jean-Baptiste Andrea Wins Goncourt Prize With Sprawling Novel
description: Jean-Baptiste Andrea received the Goncourt Prize, Frances most prestigious literary award, on Tuesday for his novel Watching Over Her, or Veiller Sur Elle.

title: Ukraine Investigates Birthday Explosion That Killed Military Aide
description: Ukrainian prosecutors announced on Tuesday that they had opened an investigation into a bizarre explosion at a birthday celebration that killed an aide to Ukraines top military commander, in what the authorities portrayed as a tragic accident.

title: Euclid Telescope Dazzles With Detailed First Images of Our Universe
description: Whether capturing spiral galaxies or stellar nurseries, Euclid is showing off our universes good side.

title: A Report Card for Bidenomics
description: With a year to go before Election Day, polls increasingly show that American voters believe next year will be a rematch between President Biden and Donald Trump  with the former president in the lead in key battleground states despite his legal troubles (more on that below).

title: California College Campuses Convulsed in Protest During Israel-Hamas War
description: Tensions have been especially high on university campuses since the war between Israel and Hamas began a month ago.

title: Ohio Is Voting on Whether to Establish Abortion Rights
description: Ohio voters are deciding on a ballot measure that would amend the states Constitution to explicitly guarantee the right to abortion.

title: Climate Protesters Damage a Celebrated Velzquez Painting in London
description: When the suffragist Mary Richardson walked into the National Gallery in London with a concealed hatchet in March 1914, she headed for the Rokeby Venus, one of Diego Velzquezs most celebrated paintings, and slashed it repeatedly.

title: Israels Central Bank Props Up Shekel After Plunge
description: The Bank of Israel said on Tuesday that it had spent $7.3 billion to support the shekel, which had fallen to an eight-year low after Hamass attack on Oct. 7. The currency is now back to about where it was before the invasion, and on Tuesday was trading at around 3.87 shekels to the dollar.

title: Gun Law Before Court Is Most Often Used as a Deterrent
description: The federal law at the heart of a major Supreme Court case that could help determine the scope of gun rights in the United States deals with one of the countrys most vexing problems. While the statute has not been used to prosecute a substantial number of people subject to domestic violence orders who are carrying guns, its greatest effect has been as a deterrent.

title: Portugals Prime Minister Resigns Unexpectedly
description: Prime Minister Antnio Costa of Portugal resigned unexpectedly on Tuesday, hours after the police raided government buildings as part of an inquiry into corruption and influence peddling and issued an arrest warrant for Mr. Costas chief of staff.

title: Get Ahead on Thanksgiving With This Make-Ahead Turkey
description: In a perfect world, youd always be able to serve your Thanksgiving turkey directly after its sojourn in the oven. Its the best way to take advantage of the birds crisp juiciness and meaty aroma  not to mention a chance to hide in the kitchen from football games.

title: A Win and a Warning Ahead of COP28
description: Last year, the annual United Nations climate talks ended with a landmark agreement to compensate poor countries for destruction from climate disasters that have been made worse by emissions from wealthy nations.

title: This Recipe is WOW!
description: Ive been on a chickpea kick lately, enabled by a stockpile of dried chickpeas and Ella Quittners extremely thorough guide to cooking them well. Her guide includes pressure cooker times  exactly what I needed.

title: Automakers Delay Electric Vehicle Spending as Demand Slows
description: Normally a 50 percent increase in sales is considered very good. But when the number of electric vehicles sold in the United States grew that much during the third quarter from a year earlier, it was a disappointment.

title: The Ad Wars Have Been Fierce. Heres What Voters Have Seen.
description: Tens of millions of dollars have poured into television advertising in the four states with major elections on Tuesday, a sign of the national implications of their outcomes.

title: The Biggest Winner at the Oscars of American Fashion
description: How political should fashion get? At least when it comes to acceptance speeches. That was the elephant  or woolly mammoth, or orca  in the room Monday night at the Council of Fashion Designers of America awards, a.k.a. the Oscars of fashion.

title: How Can Absurd Luxury Prices be Justified?
description: Historically, luxury fashion brands have enjoyed strong pricing power, meaning that they can apply considerable increases without necessarily losing customers. But in 2023, price tags hit eye-watering highs  and there has been no sign of the trend slowing.

title: Snatch Adams Review: Gross-Out Humor for Not-So-Easily-Shocked Liberals
description: The usually unassuming Soho Rep entrance is now flanked by giant labia glinting with gold-and-fuchsia sequins. Beyond them, a flamingo-pink-hued tunnel leads to the intimate stage, where a colossal pair of brassy legs are splayed as if for a gynecological exam in an amusement park fun house.

title: King Charles III Opens Parliament For the First Time as Monarch
description: King Charles outlined the British governments legislative priorities during his opening address of Parliament.

title: A Rap Comedy Hits the Road
description: When Rap Sh!t premiered in July 2022, the sitcom embraced Miamis Black cultural landscape, as well as the recent female MC renaissance, with a rags-to-slightly-nicer-rags tale of two locals chasing a hip-hop dream.

title: Barbra Streisand Is Ready to Tell All. Pull Up a Seat.
description: Maybe its her grandkids, maybe its being 81, but Barbra Streisand is open to new stuff. Take sharing. Well, take sharing herself. My Name Is Barbra, her first memoir, is upon us. Its 970 pages and billows with doubt, anger, ardor, hurt, pride, persuasion, glory and Yiddish. I dont know that any artist has done more sharing.

title: Consumer Bureau Seeks to Supervise Digital Payment Apps
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau wants to extend its watchdog powers to cover digital wallets and payment apps run by companies like Apple, Google, PayPal and Block, which do not have traditional banking operations.

title: Should Schools Curb Grade Inflation?
description: To the Editor:

title: Taking Note as Dance Reflections Takes a Pause
description: Dance Reflections, a festival dedicated to choreographic innovation, is not ready to wrap yet: It picks up again next week with a collaboration between the choreographer Dimitri Chamblas and the musician Kim Gordon.

description: See results for key races in the Nov. 7 general election.

title: Black Panther Stuntman and 3 Children Die in Georgia Car Crash
description: Taraja Ramsess, a stunt performer who worked on the Black Panther and Avengers Marvel franchises, died in a car crash near Atlanta last week that also killed three of his children, the authorities said.

title: Ohio Votes on Whether to Legalize Recreational Marijuana
description: While there has been a great deal of attention given to the abortion rights amendment on Ohios ballot, voters are being asked another big question: whether they want to legalize the recreational use of marijuana.

title: Orcas Sink Fourth Boat Off Iberia, Unnerving Sailors
description: The yacht Grazie Mamma II carried its crew along the coastlines and archipelagos of the Mediterranean. Its last adventure was off the coast of Morocco last week, when it encountered a pod of orcas.

title: Infants Are Born With Syphilis in Growing Numbers, a Sign of a Wider Epidemic
description: The rise in sexually transmitted infections in the United States has taken a particularly tragic turn: More than 3,700 cases of congenital syphilis were reported in 2022, roughly 11 times the number recorded a decade ago, according to data released on Tuesday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Room-Temperature Superconductor Discovery Is Retracted
description: Nature, one of the most prestigious journals in scientific publishing, on Tuesday retracted a high-profile paper it had published in March that claimed the discovery of a superconductor that worked at everyday temperatures.

title: Thousands of Civilians in Northern Gaza Flee to the South
description: The Israeli military has urged Gazans to evacuate to the south as forces close in on Gaza City.

title: Senate Confirms Bidens Pick for N.I.H. Director Over Sanderss Objections
description: The Senate on Tuesday confirmed Dr. Monica M. Bertagnolli, a cancer surgeon who currently leads the National Cancer Institute, as the next director of the National Institutes of Health, overriding the objections of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, the chairman of the Senate health committee.

title: Why Southern Baptists are Furious Over a Sex Abuse Case in Kentucky
description: For six months, almost no one took notice of the brief filed quietly by Southern Baptists in a case winding its way to the Kentucky Supreme Court.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Amjad Iraqi
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Amjad Iraqi. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Police Arrest Man With Rifle Near the Capitol
description: The United States Capitol Police arrested a Georgia man with a rifle near the Capitol and Senate office buildings on Tuesday afternoon, putting Congress and the Capitol complex on high alert.

title: Something Was Wrong: Ukrainians Lament Deaths at Medal Ceremony
description: The family of Major Serhiy Kuznyev sensed something was wrong. He was not answering his phone. Officers in his unit refused to provide information on him.

title: 7 New Songs You Should Hear Now
description: For some people, early November heralds the beginning of the holiday season. But for music critics and fans, its the beginning of an entirely different, equally frantic season: time to start working on Best of the Year lists and checking them (at least) twice.

title: Why Did So Many Economists Get Disinflation Wrong?
description: The Brookings Papers on Economic Activity, a conference held twice a year, is Americas premier forum for relating academic research to the most urgent economic challenges of the day, according to the Brookings Institution website. The lead presentation at the September 2022 conference was a paper by Laurence Ball, Daniel Leigh and Prachi Mishra on inflation. And its conclusions were dismal. Harvards Jason Furman, one of the assigned discussants, wrote an opinion piece calling it the scariest economics paper of 2022, suggesting that to get inflation down to 2 percent we may need to tolerate unemployment of 6.5 percent for two years.

title: Trumps Rivals Battle Each Other, and His Aura of Inevitability, as Next Debate Approaches
description: The 2024 Republican presidential race is entering a fraught and caustic new phase, as Donald J. Trumps wide lead remains undiminished, the days until voting begins dwindle and his rivals take aim at each other as much as at him.

title: As War Closes In, Many Remain in Northern Gaza
description: They knew it would be perilous, but Jinan Al Salya and her family decided to heed Israeli directions to evacuate the northern Gaza Strip and head south. They hadnt gone far on Saturday, she said, when they came under fire.

title: Tiny Love Stories: I Got Married to Avoid Myself
description: Hell is texting two guys whose names start with B and trying to keep them straight. Bruce likes the Dead, Giants baseball, my breasts. Bob likes philosophy, books, cats. Bruce has magic hands. Bob loves my writing and showers me with praise. Bruce lives close by, but works an early shift and goes to sleep at 6 p.m. Bob lives off-the-grid in a mountain cabin. I juggle both, seeing Bruce for brunch on Sundays and having long meaningful conversations late at night with Bob. Neither is right, but half of each duct taped together creates a man to meet my needs.  Diane Elizabeth Bouchard

title: Cyberattack Disrupts Mortgage Payments for Millions of Mr. Cooper Customers
description: Mr. Cooper, one of Americas largest nonbank mortgage loan servicers, suffered a cyberattack last week that disrupted loan payments and other transactions for millions of customers.

title: House Censures Rashida Tlaib, Citing River to the Sea Slogan
description: The House voted on Tuesday to censure Representative Rashida Tlaib, Democrat of Michigan, formally rebuking the sole Palestinian American in Congress for her statements regarding the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Barry Manilow Finally Gets His Wish: a Broadway Show
description: Barry Manilow is superstitious.

title: Wednesday Briefing: Israel Plans a Long-Term Role in Gaza
description: As the Israeli military campaign against Hamas entered its second month, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu offered some indication of Israels plan for the wars aftermath. He said that Israel will need to oversee the security of the Gaza Strip once the fighting is over to prevent future attacks.

title: Restaurant Review: At the Noortwyck, an Eleven Madison Park Chef Gets Neighborly
description: For years, one of Eleven Madison Parks favorite party tricks has been inviting diners midway through the meal to have a drink in the kitchen. If you accept, you will be led to a spot against the back wall behind a shallow ledge that looks something like a communion rail. There you stand as an elaborate cocktail is mixed, narrated and poured. You get to check out the cooks at their stations, and they get to check you out.

title: Meloni Says Shell Send Migrants to Albania. Some Say Not So Fast.
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni of Italy on Tuesday heralded an agreement she had struck with Albania, a non-European Union nation, to outsource the processing and containment of migrants as a breakthrough for one of the continents most defining challenges.

title: Mortimer Downey, Titan of Transit for New York and Nation, Dies at 87
description: Mortimer L. Downey, whose creative financing helped revive New York Citys subway system and who also oversaw far-reaching regional and federal transportation policy for more than six decades, died on Thursday at a retirement home in Oakton, Va. He was 87.

title: Arab States Intensify Pleas for Gaza Cease-fire as Public Anger Mounts
description: Facing growing anger from their own people, Arab countries are intensifying their appeals to the United States to pressure Israel to implement an immediate cease-fire in Gaza or risk sabotaging the security of the entire Middle East.

title: Workers in Sweden Will Expand Strike Against Tesla
description: Unions across Sweden said on Tuesday that they would support an effort to pressure Tesla to sign a collective bargaining agreement with its 120 mechanics, joining a campaign to defend a model of organized labor that many Swedes say is essential to the countrys economic success and stability.

title: The Rise and Fall and Rise of San Francisco
description: Beset, on the one hand, by starry-eyed admirers, and on the other, by doom-and-gloom detractors, San Francisco has become a political hockey puck, slapped around with little regard for its actual qualities. Two very engaging new books attempt to give the city its due, presenting it not as an abstraction but as a place  albeit a very dramatic one, swinging precipitously between crisis and rebirth.

title: House Republicans Toil for a Spending Strategy With a Shutdown Close at Hand
description: House Republicans on Tuesday grasped for a way to avert a government shutdown amid deep divides in their ranks over federal spending, debating how to strike a compromise with the Democratic-led Senate and President Biden just 10 days away from the funding deadline.

title: Morning in America Eludes Biden, Despite Economic Gains
description: President Ronald Reagan rode a Morning in America message to a blowout re-election victory in 1984, based partly on warm feelings about his economic performance. Todays economy is similar in many ways to Mr. Reagans as he entered that campaign, with one big difference: There is widespread voter angst over the incumbents economic stewardship.

title: When Will We Have Election Results?
description: It is, of course, impossible to predict exactly when election results will be available.

title: Israel Plans to Control Overall Security of Gaza After War
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has offered the clearest indication to date about what Israel may be planning for the aftermath of the war in the Gaza Strip, warning that it will need to oversee overall security there once the fighting is over to prevent future attacks.

title: What New York Voters Care About: Migrants and the High Cost of Living
description: From Brooklyn to the Bronx, voters across New York City trickled into polling sites on Tuesday, after a morning workout or during their lunch breaks, to cast ballots in races for City Council, district attorney and other local offices.

title: Fire Destroys World War II-Era Blimp Hangar in California
description: A fire on Tuesday destroyed a cavernous wooden blimp hangar in Tustin, Calif., that played a pivotal role during World War II, the authorities said.

title: Heres Where Wildfires Are Burning Across the Southern U.S.
description: Wildfires caused by drought, warmer-than-normal temperatures and, in a few cases, possibly arson have been ablaze for days in several Southern states. The threat has led officials to enact burn bans and to stop issuing safe-burn permits.

title: When Do the Polls Close?
description: Polls in states with major elections will close on Tuesday across a three-hour period nationwide, beginning at 6 p.m. Eastern time in Kentucky and ending at 9 p.m. Eastern time in Colorado, New York and parts of Texas.

title: Whats at Stake in Todays Elections
description: Today is Election Day in many U.S. states. And even though were in what political analysts call an off-year  with neither a presidential election nor midterm congressional elections  a steady stream of voters still showed up at polling stations.

title: Mel Sembler, Developer and G.O.P. Fund-Raiser, Is Dead at 93
description: Mel Sembler, a gregarious developer and major Republican fund-raiser whose largess was repaid with prize ambassadorships by two presidents, and who founded a controversy-courting tough love drug rehabilitation program, died on Oct. 31 at his home in St. Petersburg, Fla. He was 93.

title: More Than 20 Report Burning Eyes After NFT Festival in Hong Kong
description: More than 20 people have reported burning eye pain and vision problems after attending a party for NFT owners in Hong Kong last weekend, the organizers said on Tuesday.

title: Reoccupying Gaza Not the Right Thing to Do, White House Tells Israel
description: The White House cautioned Israel on Tuesday against reoccupying Gaza after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu suggested that his country could hold a security role there for an indefinite period once the war is over.

title: For Americas Jews, Every Day Must Be Oct. 8
description: There used to be a sign (which, for all I know, is still there) somewhere in the C.I.A.s headquarters that read, Every day is Sept. 12. It was placed there to remind the agencys staffers that what they felt right after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001  the sense of outrage and purpose, of favoring initiative over caution, of taking nothing for granted  had to be the mind-set with which they arrived to work every day.

title: Leave It to Beavers? Not if Youre a Wolf.
description: Beavers are influential. By cutting trees and damming streams, these rodents change the world around them, raising water levels and creating habitats for diverse plants, insects, fish and more. They are some of the worlds best-known ecosystem engineers, a term for species that produce outsize effects on their environments.

title: Fire Engulfs Historic Blimp Hangar in California
description: More than 70 firefighters responded, hoping to contain a fire in one of two colossal hangars at the former Marine Corps Air Station Tustin.

title: Peace Corps, Criticized for Medical Care, Settles Wrongful-Death Suit for $750,000
description: The Peace Corps, which has repeatedly come under scrutiny for the medical care it provides to volunteers, has agreed to pay $750,000 to settle a lawsuit brought by the family of a 24-year-old volunteer who died of undiagnosed malaria in the island nation of Comoros off the coast of East Africa.

title: Ohio Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the 2023 Ohio elections.

title: Cherelle Parker, a Democrat, Elected Mayor of Philadelphia
description: Cherelle Parker, a longtime state and local elected official who promised Philadelphia residents that she would aggressively tackle the citys crime woes, was elected mayor Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, making her the first woman voted into the citys highest office.

title: Andy Beshear, a Democrat, Defeats Daniel Cameron to Remain Kentucky Governor
description: Gov. Andy Beshear of Kentucky won a second term on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, earning a noteworthy victory for a Democrat in a deeply conservative state and one that validated his pragmatic approach over a first term buffeted by a series of natural disasters.

title: Kentucky Governor Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the 2023 Kentucky elections.

title: Ohio Vote Continues a Winning Streak for Abortion Rights
description: Ohios resounding approval of a ballot measure enshrining a right to abortion in the State Constitution continued a winning streak for abortion-rights groups that have appealed directly to voters after the demise of Roe v. Wade.

title: Republicans Retain Control of Agriculture Job in Kentucky
description: Jonathan Shell, a former Republican state legislator, won an open seat on Tuesday to become Kentuckys next agriculture commissioner, according to The Associated Press, easily defeating a Democrat who was running for office for the first time.

title: Ohio Issue 2 Election Results: Legalize Marijuana
description: See full results and maps from the 2023 Ohio elections.

title: Hoexters, With Deep Ties to the Upper East Side, Returns With a Refresh
description: Back in the 1970s and 80s, the Upper East Side was a dining destination. Summon memories, if you can, of the Sign of the Dove, Parioli Romanissimo, Mortimers, Elaines, David K, Quo Vadis, Le Cirque, Jams, Arcadia, An American Place and many more. On the list was a chop house, Hoexters Market (two stars from Mimi Sheraton in The New York Times in 1978). It was an adjunct to a butcher shop, also called Hoexters Market, both owned by Robert Shapiro who went on to open Flex Mussels in more than one location. Hoexters Market, with a checker logo (as in checker cabs, another memory) closed in the mid-80s. But recently, Alexandra Shapiro, a daughter of Mr. Shapiro, and Laura Shapiro, his wife, have been determined to revive Hoexters. Its been my mission, Alexandra said. And the family has done it.  Steps from the original location, it has dropped the Market from the name. Enter into the bar, forest green with fanciful wallpaper, then proceed to the main dining room with rough brick and plaid on the walls, tablecloths and a mural showing regulars from the original restaurant. Another dining room beyond has a shimmering chandelier, red leather banquettes and a celestial theme, and doubles as a party space. The chef, Lauren Schwichtenberg, has roots in Oklahoma and Minnesota, and her menu is as contemporary as its double smash cheeseburger. Also on offer are tuna crudo, onion soup, steamed artichoke, chopped salad, pork Milanese, a roast chicken, Faroe Island salmon with smoked beurre blanc and prime rib for two. (Opens Saturday)

title: Mother of Uvalde Shooting Victim Loses Mayors Race to Political Veteran
description: Kimberly Mata-Rubio, whose daughter was killed last year in a mass shooting at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, lost a special election to become mayor of a city that has struggled with divisions in the aftermath of the tragedy, The Associated Press reported.

title: Print Specification
description: Jump to: Todays Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Pennsylvania Election Results
description: See full results and maps from the 2023 Pennsylvania elections.

title: Joe Hogsett, a Democrat, Wins a Third Term as Indianapolis Mayor
description: Joe Hogsett, a Democrat, won a third term as mayor of Indianapolis, defeating a Republican businessman who spent more than $13 million of his own money on the race. Mr. Hogsett announced his win to supporters on Tuesday evening after his opponent, Jefferson Shreve, delivered a concession speech as votes were still being counted.

title: Democrat Repels G.O.P. Incursion in Southern Brooklyn City Council Race
description: A moderate Democrat who is among the New York City Councils most powerful members beat his Republican opponent on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press. By prevailing in the southern Brooklyn race, Democrats held a council seat that had shown signs of drifting away from their control.

title: Philadelphia Mayor Election Results
description: See all result and maps from the 2023 Philadelphia mayoral election

title: Former C.I.A. Officer Pleads Guilty to Sexual Abuse Charges
description: A former C.I.A. officer who worked at the American Embassy in Mexico City pleaded guilty on Tuesday to drugging and sexually assaulting more than two dozen women over a period of 14 years, the Justice Department said.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Hero of the Next Blackout: The School Bus
description: Were on the edge of the technology, which doesnt happen often for school buses.

title: Corrections: Nov. 8, 2023
description: An article on Saturday about a temporary lift of the gag order imposed on former President Donald J. Trump referred incorrectly to the duration that a gag order imposed on Mr. Trump will be paused. A federal appeals court in Washington set no timeline for the length of the pause; the court did not lift the gag order for about two weeks, though it did set a two-week timetable for the parties to file papers in Mr. Trumps overarching appeal of the order.

title: Republicans Flip One of 2 Key County Executive Seats in New York
description: Republicans won the county executives office in Suffolk County, N.Y., for the first time in two decades on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, reclaiming what had been one of the last Democratic strongholds in the Long Island suburbs.

title: Gabe Amo Is Elected Rhode Islands First Black Member of Congress
description: Gabe Amo, a former White House staff member who worked in the Biden and Obama administrations, on Tuesday became the first Black person to represent Rhode Island in the U.S. Congress, according to The Associated Press.

title: Race for Houston Mayor Heads to a Runoff
description: The race to become Houstons mayor is heading for a runoff between two longtime Texas Democrats: United States Representative Sheila Jackson Lee and a veteran state senator, John Whitmire, according to The Associated Press. Each emerged from a field of more than a dozen candidates on Tuesday, but neither with a majority of the vote.

title: Orbans Dream of an Illiberal Pan-European Alliance Is Fading
description: Exultant after winning his fourth election in a row last year on promises to protect Christian values and keep out immigrants, Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary thanked like-minded conservatives in Poland as well as other friends abroad for their support.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Taps the Strengths of WhatsApp
description: When Facebook bought WhatsApp for $19 billion nearly a decade ago, Mark Zuckerberg made a promise: The Facebook chief said he wouldnt meddle often with the messaging app so as not to mess with a good thing.

title: Nations That Vowed to Halt Warming Are Expanding Fossil Fuels, Report Finds
description: In 2030, if current projections hold, the United States will drill for more oil and gas than at any point in its history. Russia and Saudi Arabia plan to do the same.

title: If Not Me, Who?: As Ukraine Seeks Troops, Women Prepare for the Call
description: Halyna Vynokur, a clerk in a hardware store in Kyiv, was shouldering a firearm for the first time. Iryna Sychova, a purchasing manager at a department store, disassembled and reassembled the jumble of rods and springs in a Kalashnikov rifle.

title: Germans Recoil at Push to Rename Anne Frank Day Care
description: A proposal in a small German town to rename a public day care center that is currently named after Anne Frank has become the center of a fraught national debate in the country about antisemitism.

title: A New Answer for Migrants in Central America: Bus Them North
description: Miranda Villasmil guided her daughter and son past hundreds of huddled migrants, many still muddied and swollen from their trek here to Costa Rica from South America. The family of three carried just two grocery bags of their belongings from their past lives in Venezuela.

title: Mississippi Re-elects Gov. Tate Reeves, a Republican
description: Gov. Tate Reeves of Mississippi secured a second term, according to The Associated Press, fending off a vigorous challenge from Brandon Presley, a conservative Democrat whom he cast as a far-left acolyte of President Biden, and overcoming concerns about a shortage of excitement among conservatives.

title: N.J. Democrats Retain Legislative Majority After Hard-Fought Races
description: Democrats in New Jersey retained a comfortable majority in the General Assembly and the State Senate in Tuesdays legislative races.

title: Democrats Take Control of Virginia Legislature
description: Democrats retook full control of the Virginia General Assembly, The Associated Press reported, handing a defeat to Gov. Glenn Youngkin, a Republican who had poured millions of dollars and his personal political capital into expanding power for his party in the legislature.

title: Virginia State Legislature Election Results
description: See full results from the Virginia state election.

title: Virginia Dashes Youngkins Hopes of a G.O.P. Takeover, and Maybe More
description: For months, some of the Republican Partys top donors have dreamed of a dramatic late entrance into the presidential race by Gov. Glenn Youngkin of Virginia, envisioning an improbable scenario in which the fleece-vested former financier rips control of the party away from Donald J. Trump.

title: What Voters Want That Trump Seems to Have
description: So about that poll. You know the one: the Times/Siena poll showing Donald Trump with an edge over President Biden in five out of six swing states, and suggesting a softening of support for Mr. Biden among Black, Latino and young voters.

title: The Road Back From Hell
description: Each day the Israel-Gaza war continues, the risks of a cataclysm intensify.

title: How Abortion Lifted Democrats, and More Takeaways From Tuesdays Elections
description: The political potency of abortion rights proved more powerful than the drag of President Bidens approval ratings in Tuesdays off-year elections, as Ohioans enshrined a right to abortion in their states constitution, and Democrats took control of both chambers of the Virginia General Assembly while holding on to Kentuckys governorship.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: Amid growing despair and rage, Arab countries including Saudi Arabia, Jordan and Egypt are intensifying their appeals to the U.S. to pressure Israel for an immediate cease-fire in Gaza. Failure to do so, they say, risks sabotaging the security of the entire Middle East.

title: Jimmy Fallon Pokes Fun at the Republican Debates Lackluster Lineup
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: extrapolate
description: The word extrapolate has appeared in 32 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on July 27 in The Beanie Bubble Review: Caught in a Fad Romance by Calum Marsh:

title: Where Trump Counties in Ohio Voted to Support Abortion Rights
description: Ohios referendum drew support from both liberal and conservative areas of the state, and polled well ahead of President Bidens results three years ago.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

title: Her Retirement Home Said No to Solar Panels. She Got It to Buy 1,344.
description: Susan Auslander, at 89, is an energetic, convent-educated, white-haired Prius driver, and when her retirement community told her it was not feasible to convert to solar power, Ms. Auslander decided to push back. That push turned into a five-year campaign.

title: Ivanka Trump Testifies She Wasnt Privy to Fathers Finances
description: Her father went on the attack. Her brothers backed away. And on Wednesday, Ivanka Trump calmly sidestepped accusations that her familys business prospered thanks to a lie.

title: How to Hijack a Quarter of a Million Dollars in Rare Japanese Kit Kats
description: Danny Taings 55,000 Kit Kats began their long, twisted and sometimes obscure journey in Japan.

title: Eagle and Ropes
description: What do you think this image is saying? How does it relate to or comment on society or current events? Can you relate to it personally? What is your opinion of its message?

title: How One Small Statistic Became a Story That Spanned a Continent
description: The two-story house in Nairobi, Kenya that New York Times journalists have been renting since the early 2000s had some notable features when my family moved in three years ago: banana, guava and avocado trees; a thatched, mud-walled hut in the garden, built by a previous Times reporter; and a small library of books about Africa amassed over several decades.

title: An Undersea Volcano Is Building a New Island in Japan
description: Three weeks ago, the view from Iwo Jima showed open ocean. Now theres a tiny new island right offshore, billowing smoke as it grows and offering a rare glimpse at how volcanic islands emerge.

title: Whats the Easiest Houseplant? Many Experts Will Give You One Answer.
description: And the answer is: Bromeliads.

title: A New Law Supercharged Electric Car Manufacturing, but Not Sales
description: President Bidens signature climate law has stimulated a surge of investment in electric vehicle production across the country, including tens of billions of dollars on battery plants across the South and new assembly lines near the Great Lakes. Based on early evidence, it is succeeding at a goal that economists have long considered difficult and costly: using the power of government to rapidly grow a new industry.

title: Wacky, Curvaceous Houses in Brazil That Feel Like Cocoons
description: THE POLISH BRAZILIAN designer and architect Jorge Zalszupin hated the beach, but he loved the beach house he built in 1972 for his family. Set back from the Atlantic coast in Guaruj, a resort town 40 miles southeast of So Paulo, the 2,842-square-foot white concrete dwelling looks like a block of bleached coral pulled from the ocean. The front door opens onto a spiral staircase that leads to a pair of bedrooms and a lofted lounge; below, the walls of a sunken living room curve up to a sculptural ceiling. A built-in couch wraps around a bell-shaped fireplace, its crescent hearth like an open mouth. Shielded from the Brazilian sun that his wife, a homemaker named Annette, and two daughters adored, Zalszupin would spend entire weekends listening to Chet Baker and Brahms, bent over mounds of clay that he formed into models for chairs and sofas  the furniture that had won him acclaim by the end of the 1950s  and for houses that were, until recently, far less known.

title: A Cooks Tour of the Tokyo Food Scene
description: Its a Monday afternoon in the Tsukiji branch of the Tokyo Sushi Academy and were about to be put to the test. Or I am anyway. Most of the other students enrolled in the Japanese Culinary Intensive course are professionals. They are local or from abroad, just brushing up on skills or adding to their repertoire. My bench mate works charter yachts out of Australia. Our sensei, the chef Hiro Tsumoto, noticed a tattoo on his forearm with Japanese characters and called out: Hey, thats my aunts name!

title: Living In ... Medford, N.J.
description: The Burlington County community often surprises new residents with its woodsy vibe: Its not at all what we thought of when we thought of New Jersey.

title: Medford, N.J.: A Rural Township With a Quaint Downtown
description: After the Campbell Soup Company announced a reorganization early this year, Quinton and Jacquelyn Cookis had a choice to make. They could move with the companys snacks division, where they both worked, to its new consolidated headquarters in Camden, N.J., or shift to other Campbell operations in Connecticut or North Carolina, where they were living.

title: How Do You Deal With Conflicts?
description: A stranger skips in front of you on line.

title: $800,000 Homes in Rhode Island, Oregon and Ohio
description: This house, built for Esbon Sanford, a local factory owner, has been sensitively updated, with much of its original character retained, and it is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. It is about a five-minute drive from North Kingstown Town Beach and from John H. Chafee Nature Preserve, where walking trails lead to a rocky expanse of waterfront.

title: Hes Too Old, and I Feel Poor!: Three Writers Discuss Voter Polls, Biden and the G.O.P.
description: Frank Bruni, a contributing Opinion writer, hosted a written online conversation with Katherine Mangu-Ward, the editor in chief of Reason magazine, and Nate Silver, the founder and former editor of FiveThirtyEight and the author of the newsletter Silver Bulletin, to discuss their expectations for the third Republican debate on Wednesday night. They also dug into and sorted through a blizzard of political news  particularly the new New York Times/Siena battleground-state polling with dreadful news for President Biden that has Democrats freaked out (again).

title: Pasta and Rice May Be Healthier as Leftovers. Heres Why.
description: It sounds like just another internet health hack: Cook some pasta or white rice and let it cool overnight in the refrigerator. By the next day, some of the natural starches in the food will have transformed into healthier versions, called resistant starches, which have been linked to a range of health benefits including lower blood sugar, better gut health and a reduced risk of certain types of cancer.

title: Slowly and Steadily, Snails Have Overtaken the Runway
description: In September, at Pradas spring 2024 womens show, models walked between translucent curtains of pink slime that dripped from the ceiling and pooled on the floor. The brand referred to them as fluid interruptions, a concept that was echoed in the collections flowing organza dresses and fringed skirts. Above all, though, it evoked the secretions of a snail, an animal that has recently been crawling into the realms of design and fashion.

title: Environmental Groups Cut Programs as Funding Shifts to Climate Change
description: A significant shift in donor contributions to nonprofits fighting climate change in recent years has left some of the nations biggest environmental organizations facing critical shortfalls in programs on toxic chemicals, radioactive contamination and wildlife protection.

title: Gen Alpha Is Here. Can You Understand Their Slang?
description: Do you know what a gyat is? What about a rizzler? And how, precisely, does one pay a Fanum tax?

title: Why Mike Johnsons Speakership Does Not Bode Well for America
description: Representative Mike Johnson wasnt the first  or second  choice for speaker of the House, but he was the only congressman to successfully secure a majority of votes. He now faces his first major test with a deadline looming for a government shutdown on Nov. 17.

title: Edel Rodriguez Isnt Afraid to Live With the Consequences
description: The hardest thing about making political art, says Edel Rodriguez, isnt technique but judgment: knowing just where to stick the tip of the knife so that audiences feel provoked without crying foul.

title: Frances Justice Minister Goes on Trial, Accused of Abusing His Power
description: Even in France, where political corruption cases abound, it was a sight to behold: the countrys justice minister standing alone before two rows of judges in an ancient, wood-paneled courtroom to defend himself over accusations about his own use  or abuse  of power.

title: What Does the U.S. Space Force Actually Do?
description: Chief Master Sgt. Ron Lerch of the U.S. Space Force sat down in his office in Los Angeles one morning in September to deliver a briefing known as a threat assessment. The current threats in space are less sci-fi than you might expect, but there are a surprising number of them: At least 44,500 space objects now circle Earth, including 9,000 active satellites and 19,000 significant pieces of debris.
