description: Around the neck, over the head, draped down the back, pinned into hair, wrapped around a face  there are many ways to style a kaffiyeh, the square checkered scarf traditionally worn in parts of the Middle East.

title: Silicon Valleys Big, Bold Sci-Fi Bet on the Device That Comes After the Smartphone
description: Inside a former horse stable in the San Francisco neighborhood of SoMa, a wave of gentle chirps emerged from small, blinking devices pinned to the chests of employees at a start-up called Humane.

title: Matisse and Derain: The Audacious Wild Beasts of Fauvism in a Radiant Show
description: If you ever took an art history survey in college, you may recall the blur of Fauvism. In the parade of projected images, it was the shocking flash of pure color that sped past as the course made its way to the more demanding rigors and longer shelf lives of Picassos Les Demoiselles dAvignon and Cubism.

title: Can A.I. and Lasers Cure Our Smartphone Addiction?
description: An aqua blue light appeared on my outstretched palm, showing a menu. Slowly, I circled my wrist to scroll, pressing an index finger and thumb together in a pinching motion to select an item. I wanted to send a text message. The device on my sweater, a two-inch square magnetic pin from a start-up called Humane, let out a soft clink.

title: Megyn Kelly Will Moderate the Next G.O.P. Debate, on NewsNation
description: Megyn Kelly, whose high-flying career as a Fox News anchor fell to earth after an ill-advised move to NBC  and then remade herself as a conservative podcaster and radio host  is set to return to the political spotlight next month as a moderator for the next Republican primary debate.

title: The Republican Alternatives to Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: Young Thug Lyrics Will Be Allowed as Evidence in YSL RICO Trial
description: A judge decided on Thursday that rap lyrics by the Atlanta artist Young Thug and his collaborators will be allowed as evidence in the racketeering trial of YSL, a chart-topping hip-hop label and collective that prosecutors say is also a criminal street gang responsible for violent crimes.

title: Barbra Streisand Has Always Called the Shots
description: Barbra Streisands long-awaited memoir, My Name Is Barbra, is nearly a thousand pages of soul-baring and score-settling  with plenty of Yiddish thrown in. Wesley Morris and Alexandra Jacobs discuss the books most surprising revelations. Plus, we get a glimpse of Wesleys visit with the living legend at her Malibu home.

title: They Risked Their Lives to Clean New York Offices. Now They May Strike.
description: Danuta Klimas, an office cleaner, went back to work in Lower Manhattan days after the Sept. 11 attacks, as toxic dust from ground zero hung in the air. She was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer years later.

title: Deal Granting Amnesty to Separatists Sets Off Turmoil in Spain
description: Prime Minister Pedro Snchez of Spain sealed a deal to extend amnesty to Catalan separatists on Thursday in exchange for their political support, likely allowing him to stay in power but causing turmoil throughout Spain, doubts in Europe and questions about the countrys stability.

title: Blue Lagoon in Iceland Temporarily Closes After Thousands of Earthquakes
description: Thousands of earthquakes recorded over the past few days have led to the pre-emptive closure of the Blue Lagoon, a popular tourist destination in Iceland.

title: F.B.I. Director Casts Doubt on Decision to Relocate Its Headquarters to Maryland
description: Christopher A. Wray, the director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, on Thursday blasted the Biden administrations selection of Greenbelt, Md., for the bureaus new headquarters, citing a flawed process and suggesting that a top federal official had a conflict of interest.

title: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: A couple of nights ago, I got to see the 2016 winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature doing his thing onstage  his thing being music, not books, since the laureate in question is Bob Dylan. But as it happens, there is an expansive new Dylan book on the shelves right now, which combs through his vast archives to offer a selection of letters, handwritten lyrics, old photos and other ephemera.

title: This Much We Know Review: Asking Why After a Friends Death
description: Our yearning for answers and the limits of knowing are at the heart of the intricately crafted, unsettling documentary This Much We Know. The director L. Frances Henderson based this very personal debut on John DAgatas lauded book About a Mountain, which deftly yoked the suicide of a teenager in Las Vegas to the Department of Energys since-scuttled plans to use Yucca Mountain, 100 miles northwest of that city, as a repository for nuclear waste.

title: Review: Kyle Marshalls History Lessons, in Fragments
description: Kyle Marshalls dance Onyx has a historical subject: the Black roots of rock n roll. But dont expect the work  one of the three New York premieres that make up his companys debut program at the Joyce Theater this week  to be a straightforward parade of Black artists and their jukebox hits. Marshalls approach is exploratory and questioning.

title: Alan Hevesi, New York Official Who Fell From Grace, Dies at 83
description: Alan G. Hevesi, a cerebral, suave and blunt New York politician who spent 35 years as an elected official until he suffered a dizzying fall that led to his resignation as state comptroller and 20 months in prison for corruption, died on Thursday in the hamlet of East Meadow on Long Island. He was 83.

title: Coming Soon: More Oil, Gas and Coal
description: Its no secret that fossil fuels are still going strong, as we discussed last month. But a new United Nations-backed report paints an alarming picture of how dramatically coal, oil and gas production is expected to grow in the coming years.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: Moonlighting

title: 8 Nonalcoholic Wines for the Thanksgiving Table
description: With wine, theres no point in fighting Thanksgiving dinners kaleidoscope of flavors. Its best to find an easy way to flatter them.

title: U.K. Home Secretary Stirs Political Storm After Writing Article Attacking the Police
description: One of Britains most senior cabinet ministers, Suella Braverman, has triggered political turmoil by writing a newspaper article that attacked the countrys largest police force over its approach to a pro-Palestinian protest, and implicitly challenged the authority of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.

title: How to Host Without a Guest Room
description: Your guests can still be comfortable in the living room.

title: Americas New Wildfire Risk Goes Beyond Forests
description: Forest fires may get more attention, but a new study reveals that grassland fires are more widespread and destructive across the United States. Almost every year since 1990, the study found, grass and shrub fires burned more land than forest fires did, and they destroyed more homes, too.

title: Fed Chair Recalls Inflation Head Fakes and Pledges to Do More if Needed
description: Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, on Thursday expressed little urgency to make another interest rate increase imminently  but he reiterated that officials would adjust policy further if doing so proved necessary to cool the economy and fully restrain inflation.

title: Move Over, Gels. Heinz Wants Runners to Refuel With Ketchup.
description: You can put ketchup on a burger or fries, sure. Its a key ingredient in Russian salad dressing and meatloaf. Ketchup was once even declared a vegetable by the U.S. Agriculture Department under President Ronald Reagan.

title: The Sensory Transcendence of a French Meal, via the Big Screen
description: In France, a robust appetite is a virtue if not a heroic trait.

title: What Students Are Saying About Accountability at School
description: We asked students recently: Do schools need to do more to hold students accountable?

title: Film Club: A Toast to Raising Alcohol Taxes
description: A Toast to Raising Alcohol Taxes is a five-minute Opinion video addressing the quiet drug epidemic facing our nation  excessive drinking. Imagine a way, the Times filmmakers ask, to drastically cut the number of deaths on Americas roads, to spare many from fatal disease, something that could reduce violence and even unwanted pregnancies. The good news, they inform us, is that it actually exists: raise taxes on alcohol. The bad news is that politicians are petrified to do so.

title: An Enduring Fall Dessert for Thanksgiving
description: Every year after Halloween, when Yvette Marquez-Sharpnacks carved jack-o-lanterns looked soggy, her grandmother in El Paso saw an opportunity to repurpose them.

title: Annie Ernaux Can Read Anywhere, So Long as Its Quiet
description: What books are on your night stand?

title: In Congress and on Campuses, From the River to the Sea Inflames Debate
description: When House Republicans and a solid bloc of Democrats banded together this week to censure Representative Rashida Tlaib, Democrat of Michigan, for her statements about the Israel-Gaza war, they homed in on her embrace and defense of one pro-Palestinian slogan they called unacceptable: from the river to the sea.

title: Senate Panel Punts Effort to Force Testimony in Supreme Court Ethics Inquiry
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday abruptly put off its push to subpoena two conservative allies of Justices Samuel A. Alito Jr. and Clarence Thomas as part of a Supreme Court ethics inquiry that has met stiff resistance from Republicans.

title: Jill Stein Announces Third-Party Bid for President
description: Jill Stein, who ran unsuccessfully for president on the Green Party ticket in 2012 and 2016, will run again in 2024, she announced on Thursday  adding yet another name to the field even as the two major parties appear almost certain to nominate the same two candidates who ran in 2020.

title: Manchin Says He Will Not Seek Re-election, Dealing Blow to Democrats
description: Senator Joe Manchin III, the conservative West Virginia Democrat known for bipartisan deal-making and also for frustrating some of his partys most ambitious policy goals, announced on Thursday that he would not seek re-election, dealing a blow to Democrats chances of holding the Senate next year.

title: Linda R. Hirshman, Who Challenged Stay-at-Home Mothers, Dies at 79
description: Linda R. Hirshman, a union lawyer turned law and philosophy professor turned feminist provocateur, author and cultural historian who managed, to her delight, to enrage liberals and conservatives alike with an attack on so-called choice feminism, died on Oct. 31 in Burlington, Vt. She was 79.

title: I.O.C. Says It Was Target of Elaborate Fake News Campaign
description: The International Olympic Committee issued an unusual statement on Thursday saying it had been targeted by fake news posts that it said contained defamatory content, a fake narrative and false information. The elaborate campaign included manufactured quotations from I.O.C. representatives, fake news stories citing those fabricated comments and even a Netflix-style documentary series released online and narrated by a voice purporting to be the actor Tom Cruise.

title: Israeli Forces Have Limited Time in Gaza, U.S. Officials Say
description: The Israeli military has limited time to carry out its operations in Gaza before anger among Arabs in the region and frustration in the United States and other countries over the spiraling civilian death toll constrain Israels goal of eradicating Hamas, U.S. officials said this week.

title: House Republicans Clash Over Spending Days Ahead of Shutdown Deadline
description: At odds with one another on spending, House Republicans abruptly scrapped their legislative work on Thursday and left Washington with little progress toward funding the government and no plan to avert a shutdown next week.

title: Germany Remembers Kristallnacht at a Fraught Moment
description: In a moment heavy with symbolism, Germany on Thursday marked the 85th anniversary of Kristallnacht, the eruption of murderous Nazi violence against the countrys Jews on the night of Nov. 9, 1938.

title: No Gluten or Dairy, but Plenty to Love in These Thanksgiving Dishes
description: In Amelia Bedelia, the first volume of the childrens book series created by Peggy Parish, the title character starts a new job as a housekeeper. Before she gets to her long list of tasks, she bakes a pie with ease, even joy, because she does make a good pie. She then follows the instructions for her duties literally  when asked to dust the furniture, she sprinkles powder all over it.

title: At a Hollywood Screening, Footage of Hamas Killing Israelis
description: Having produced movies like Pulp Fiction and Reservoir Dogs, Lawrence Bender has a high tolerance for make-believe violence on film. But he wasnt sure he could sit through raw footage of the real thing: the killings of Israeli civilians by Hamas.

title: 8 Excellent Asian Noodle Soups (in Three Boroughs)
description: Last week I wrote about soup, which I suggested is not as popular as it once was, possibly because it is not cut out for the age of share plates.

title: Friday Briefing: Israel Expands Pauses in Combat
description: Israel has agreed to put in place regular daily four-hour pauses in its relentless assault on Hamas in selected areas of northern Gaza to allow civilians to flee, a White House spokesman said.

title: Former Baltimore Prosecutor Found Guilty of Perjury in Federal Court
description: Marilyn Mosby, a former Baltimore prosecutor who rose to national prominence for pursuing charges against police officers in connection with the death of Freddie Gray, was found guilty in federal court on two counts of perjury for falsely claiming financial hardship to withdraw money from a retirement fund.

title: Vatican Says Transgender People Can Be Baptized and Become Godparents
description: Pope Francis, who has made reaching out to L.G.B.T.Q. Catholics a hallmark of his papacy, has made clear that transgender people can be baptized, serve as godparents and be witnesses at church weddings, furthering his vision of a more inclusive church.

title: Investigator Stole Items From Dead Men, Prosecutors Say
description: An investigator with the Los Angeles County medical examiners office has been charged with stealing items, including a gold necklace, from two dead men, the authorities said.

title: Omegle Shuts Down as Founder Acknowledges Crime on Video Chat Site
description: Omegle, the popular website and app that paired random users through video chat, has shut down after its founder acknowledged persistent criminal activity and critics said that it had become a haven for pedophilia and child sexual abuse.

title: How to Shave Your Eyebrows
description: The makeup artist and model Raisa Flowers shaves her brows and creates a glamorous makeup look.

title: Why More People Are Shaving Their Eyebrows  And How to Do It Yourself
description: There is something distinctly queer about shaved eyebrows: their presence, or rather absence, challenges our expectations about what a face should be. And indeed, for much of the past century, they were a signal of deviance from the norm  either because a person couldnt fit in or because they refused to. Take the drag queen Divine, who in the filmmaker John Waterss 1972 trash epic, Pink Flamingos, struts down a Baltimore sidewalk wearing a slinky wrap dress, peep-toe heels and a pair of impossibly arched brows. She is undeniably glamorous, yet her brows  painted by the makeup artist and costume designer Van Smith, who first removed Divines natural ones along with part of her hairline  stamp her face with a permanent glare, as if underlining her characters self-declared status as the filthiest person alive.

title: Trump on the Stand
description: For the first time in about a decade, Donald Trump took the witness stand this week and testified extensively under oath in court. The setting was his civil fraud trial in Manhattan, where a judge is deciding what penalties he should face for inflating the value of his properties to secure favorable loan terms from banks.

title: Hearing the Music in Black American English
description: Broadway, as always, is giving us lessons on language and its connection to music. The stellar new production of Purlie Victorious, not seen on Broadway since 1961, is Exhibit A.

title: Gazans Flee Destruction and Death as They Head South
description: Israel agreed to pause military operations for a few hours daily to allow civilians in Gaza to evacuate the northern part of the strip, the White House announced.

title: Robert De Niros Company Is Found Liable for Gender Discrimination
description: A federal jury in Manhattan on Thursday found Robert De Niros company liable for gender discrimination against a former employee who claimed that the actor assigned her stereotypically female job responsibilities such as washing his sheets and attending to his home even as she climbed the ranks of his company, awarding her $1.3 million in damages.

title: Listen: Final Episode of The Kids of Rutherford County
description: Audiophiles,

title: Michelle Williams, Julianne Moore and Salman Rushdie Hit New York Galas
description: On Wednesday night, inside a cavernous event space on the Lower East Side, at the annual gala for the public art organization Creative Time, the actor Jeremy Strong said the news that striking actors and Hollywood studios had reached a tentative deal, went around the room like wildfire.

title: Israel Will Pause Combat for Hours Each Day, the U.S. Said
description: Israel has agreed to put in place regular daily four-hour pauses in its relentless assault on Hamas in northern Gaza to allow civilians to flee, according to the White House.

title: Judge Approves JPMorgans $290 Million Settlement With Epstein Victims
description: A federal judge on Thursday approved a settlement of a class-action lawsuit in which JPMorgan Chase will pay $290 million to sexual abuse victims of Jeffrey Epstein who claimed that the bank ignored warnings about the disgraced financier.

title: Israel Accuses Freelance Photographers of Advance Knowledge of Oct. 7 Attack
description: The Israeli government on Thursday accused freelance photographers for several major news organizations, including The New York Times, of being accomplices in the killing and abductions of Israeli soldiers and civilians by Hamas fighters  an allegation The Times vigorously denied about its freelancer.

title: Frank Borman, Astronaut Who Led First Orbit of the Moon, Dies at 95
description: Frank Borman, the commander of NASAs 1968 Apollo 8 spaceflight, whose astronauts became the first men to orbit the moon, captured the famed image known as Earthrise and read lines from Genesis to deliver a brief Christmastime uplift to a troubled America, died on Tuesday in Billings, Mont. He was 95.

title: Yuri Temirkanov, Conductor Who Celebrated Russias Music, Dies at 84
description: Yuri Temirkanov, a well-traveled Russian conductor steeped in his countrys bygone musical culture, died on Nov. 2 in St. Petersburg, the city where he held sway for over 30 years. He was 84.

title: Democrats: You Can Chill Out Now!
description: Well, this week has been an emotional roller coaster. On Sunday, a New York Times/Siena College poll showed President Biden behind Donald Trump in a bunch of battleground states, sending Democrats into a tizzy. Then on Tuesday, voters handed Democrats a string of election victories  the kind they have enjoyed in election after election since Trump was inaugurated in 2017.

title: What History Tells Us About the Feel-Bad Economy
description: Since Tuesdays big Democratic electoral victories, Ive been seeing some speculation to the effect that the 2024 election may be marked by a reverse coattail effect: that President Biden, whose poll numbers have supposedly been weighed down by a bad economy, may be lifted up by local candidates who have been racking up wins over social issues.

title: An Expedition Finds a Lost Mammal and a Shrimp That Lives in Trees
description: A scientific expedition to a treacherous mountain range on the island of New Guinea has collected the first-ever photographic evidence confirming the survival of a bizarre, egg-laying mammal. The team also found dozens of undescribed species of insects, as well as newfound arachnids, amphibians and even a shrimp that dwells in trees.

title: Kamala Harris Is Set to Visit South Carolina for Campaign Kickoff
description: Vice President Kamala Harris will travel to Columbia, S.C., on Friday to formally file President Bidens paperwork to appear on the Democratic primary ballot in the state, according to two people familiar with her plans.

title: Deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon Falls to a Five-Year Low
description: Deforestation in the Amazon rainforest in Brazil fell to a five-year low, the countrys National Institute of Space Research announced on Thursday, a sign that Brazil, which has the biggest share of tropical forest in the world, was making progress on its pledge to halt all deforestation by the end of the decade.

title: Joe Manchins Retirement Adds Fuel to 2024 Rumors
description: Almost since he arrived in Washington, Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia has complained about the partisan nature of the Capitol and insisted that Americans arent as politically divided as the people they send to Congress.

title: Byron Wien, Wall Street Seer of the Unexpected, Dies at 90
description: At age 80, Byron Wien compiled 20 Life Lessons from a long career as a Wall Street soothsayer. Never retire was No. 20. If you work forever, you can live forever, he explained. I know there is an abundance of biological evidence against this theory, but Im going with it anyway.

title: As Haley Rises, the Clock Is Ticking on Taking Down Trump
description: In the Republican nomination contest, even five-inch stilettos might not be enough to overcome the towering figure of Donald J. Trump.

title: Intense Protests Again Shut Down Midtown Manhattan Streets
description: Thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters calling for a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war shut down traffic in Midtown Manhattan on Thursday night, marking one of the largest actions in New York City in recent weeks.

title: Letters With Suspicious Substances Sent to Election Offices Spur Alarm
description: Suspicious letters were sent to local elections officials in at least four states, the authorities said on Thursday, including to two locations in Washington State that were said to include white powders containing the toxic drug fentanyl.

title: Apple Co-Founder Steve Wozniak Is Doing Good After Minor Stroke
description: When Steve Wozniak, the co-founder of Apple, suffered a dizzy spell on Wednesday, he took a precautionary trip to the hospital and learned that he had suffered a minor stroke. A day later, he said in an interview, the hospital released him and he was doing good.

title: Crocodile Bites Man. Man Bites Back.
description: It was a story that seemed almost too Australian to be true: The incredible tale of a crocodile attack, foiled by the gnashing of the victims jaws.

title: A Lean and Hungry Look
description: Jump to: Tricky Clues

title: Variety: Vowel-less Crossword
description: VOWEL-LESS CROSSWORD  This kind of puzzle is growing on me, and todays grid is extra alluring because of its constructor. Ryan McCarty regularly creates gnarly Saturday crosswords but has never before ventured into the weird world of variety puzzles. The vowel-less crosswords are strange enough that I find myself giggling when I solve one; I cant help but imagine someone looking over my shoulder at a jumbled sea of consonants, for starters. I also find myself counting letters on my fingers throughout and becoming lost in the process, which is a bit humbling.

title: Timepiece Gentleman Swindled Customers Out of $3 Million, U.S. Says
description: The businessman collected the luxury watches from customers, promising them that he would sell the watches on consignment and take no more than a 5 percent fee, the authorities said.

title: Celebrating a Marriage and a Second Chance at Life
description: Neither Jill Meredith Schreider nor Adam Jesse Jankelowitz drinks much alcohol  if any. But on their first date, both were too polite to interrupt the servers lengthy presentation about the restaurants four-page tequila menu.

title: A Fumbled First Kiss and the Encouragement of a Stranger
description: In 2019, Daniel Kneip Andrew made a deal with himself. He was between law school and his new job at a law firm and he decided to go on five dates. He had some time on his hands and would soon be busy. But after four lackluster meetings, his expectations were at the lowest point, Mr. Andrew said.

title: A Reconnection, Long Distance and Then a Death Bed Wedding
description: At one time, Michaela Elizabeth Cook and Jake Christopher Moyle were such close friends that he helped her choose her stage name as a singer, Micks. Even then, they would go on to lose touch for two years.

title: Quotation of the Day: No Regrets or What-Ifs, Just a Goal of Returning Georgetown to the Top
description: Never use the word never. Never is forever, and that would be the mistake I made. Never comes back to haunt you.

title: Corrections: Nov. 10, 2023
description: An article on Thursday about Danica Roem, the first transgender state senator in the South, misstated the type of meal program supported by Ms. Roem. Its a universal free school one, not a universal preschool one.

title: Nothing Could Happen Between Us
description: Last year, two days before my 29th birthday, I slipped on ice at the restaurant where I worked and sprained my ankle. Told to stay home and recover, I quickly grew bored and did what any single person with sudden downtime would do  re-downloaded my dating apps. Within 24 hours, I matched with Motorcycle Man.

title: The Greatest, and Sometimes Silliest, Love of All
description: Before Ezekiel Oliver Smith and Michael Nicolas Briones Santos attended the GLAAD Media Awards in Los Angeles in April 2018, Mr. Smith enjoyed his time alone more than his time on dates. He loved his own company, and he had a strong community and a thriving social life. When he was alone, he never felt lonely, and he thought that maybe he was happiest when he was single.

title: Presidents War Against Fake News Raises Alarms in South Korea
description: Allies of President Yoon Suk Yeol are attacking what they see as an existential threat to South Korea, and they are mincing few words. The head of Mr. Yoons party has called for the death sentence for a case of high treason. The culture ministry has vowed to root out what it called an organized and dirty conspiracy to undermine the countrys democracy.

title: Restrictions on L.G.B.T.Q. Depictions Rattle Hungarys Cultural World
description: When a far-right member of Hungarys Parliament invited the media three years ago to watch her shred a book of fairy tales that included a gay Cinderella, only one reporter showed up.

title: Friday Briefing
description: The Israeli military has limited time to carry out its operations in the Gaza Strip before anger among Arabs in the region and global frustration over the rising civilian death toll constrain Israels goal of eradicating Hamas, U.S. officials said this week.

title: In Israel, There Is Grief and There Is Fury. Beneath the Fury, Fear.
description: I landed in Israel and went straight to a funeral.

title: Pro-Palestinian Protesters Rally in New York City
description: On the steps of the New York Public Library, demonstrators waved flags and called for a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Late Night Recaps the Worst of the G.O.P. Presidential Debate
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

title: A New York Reporter With a New Perspective
description: On a warm Friday afternoon in October, Luis Ferr-Sadurn, who covers New York State politics for The New York Times, scanned the faces of a crowd at a beachfront resort in Puerto Rico. He had hoped to spot Robert Menendez, the New Jersey senator who had been indicted on federal bribery charges  and who was, nevertheless, holding his annual fund-raiser at the hotel.

title: Why the Bronx Voted Republican for the First Time in a Generation
description: Even in New York, where so many people pride themselves on their political engagement, hyperlocal elections rarely generate much interest either in terms of buzz or turnout, and they lead to surprising results even less often. But a City Council race on Tuesday managed to bring uncommon suspense. By Wednesday the contest had been called in favor of an X-ray technician who became the first Republican to win public office in the Bronx in nearly 20 years, a place where Democrats outnumber Republicans by more than 10 to 1.

title: Gadfly Lawyer for Gilgo Beach Families Courts Cameras and Tipsters
description: It seemed like a classic John Ray news conference last month, with the flamboyant Long Island lawyer stepping up to news cameras, bedecked in a polka dot tie and matching fedora.

title: Hidden Demon Uncovered in 18th-Century Painting
description: The Death of Cardinal Beaufort, a painting by Sir Joshua Reynolds depicting a scene from Shakespeares play Henry VI, Part 2, stirred controversy when it was first shown in 1789, because of a demon that lurked in its shadows.

title: U.K. Economy Stagnates as High Interest Rates Take Toll
description: The British economy flatlined in the third quarter, entering what is expected to be a protracted period of stagnation on the cusp of a recession.

title: The Window Treatments to the Soul
description: In August 2014, I was drinking alone in North London. I Googled an address, then climbed into a cab and gave it to the driver: 30 Camden Square. The car pulled up to a four-story home in a leafy neighborhood, and I immediately felt embarrassed by my macabre mission. But Id come this far. I got out of the car. The house where Amy Winehouse had died three years earlier was behind a black fence and a white wall. Across the street, there was a clearing with a tree, where a memorial collection had accumulated: photos of the beloved jazz-pop singer, flowers, candles, whiskey bottles.

title: Innocence, Here and Abroad
description: One of the funniest books I know includes a spread illustrating some of the different positions in which a man and a woman can fit together. One configuration involves a space hopper, another a skateboard. Published in 1993, Babette Coles Mummy Laid an Egg! is a Where-do-babies-come-from? book for young kids that not only tells it like it is (space hopper and all), but also jokes about the outlandish fairy tales desperate parents use to avoid discussing something they really, really dont want to talk about.

title: Deadly Fire in Africas Richest City Exposed a Secret in Plain Sight
description: Days after the fire, officials in Johannesburg reached for a well-worn script. They gathered the media for a made-for-television police raid.

title: Listen to a Wellness-Culture Satire That Delves a Few Levels Deeper
description: In a last-ditch effort to impress her boss and not get fired from her public relations job  and to keep chipping away at an overwhelming medical debt  Jane attends a woo-woo wellness retreat in order to bag its enigmatic leader, Cass, as a new client. Shes warned that this retreat may be a cult, but maybe this cult could bring in a lot of money.

title: This Is Our Music
description: The folk musicians Dom Flemons, Kara Jackson, Amythyst Kiah and Tray Wellington discuss the complications of being a Black performer working in a genre now commonly associated with whiteness.

title: A Garden Shed Becomes a Retreat Filled With Treasures
description: The window of the British interior designer Tamsin Saunderss childhood bedroom looked out onto the South Downs, the rolling hills that culminate abruptly in steep chalk cliffs along Englands southeast coast. The landscapes rugged beauty instilled in her an affinity for the patterns and textures of the natural world. She spent her early years in the nearby forests, collecting fossils and gathering fragments of wood to decorate with paint.

title: Black Folk Musicians Are Reclaiming the Genre
description: TRAY WELLINGTON KNOWS that many will take the title of his 2022 album, Black Banjo, as an oxymoron. The banjo, and with it an entire body of folk-based music, is now so thoroughly associated with whiteness as to obscure its origins in Black musical tradition. One of the first things I heard when I started playing banjo was, Youre not supposed to be doing this, says Wellington, 24, whose father is Black and mother is white. But for him, playing the banjo has become an act of reclamation.

title: The Village Home of George Lois, Visionary Adman, Is Listed for $6 Million
description: In the early 1960s, as his career as an art director and graphic designer was taking off, George Lois and his wife, Rosemary, set out to find a larger home for their expanding family. The two ultimately fell in love with the brand-new Butterfield House in Greenwich Village, so much so that they ended up buying two apartments there.

title: Rugs That Ripple Like a Stream
description: The fashion designer Marco Zaninis mother is Swedish, but growing up in his fathers native Italy, he never gave his Nordic roots much thought. It wasnt until he turned 30 that he became passionate about anything Scandinavian, says the Milan-based 52-year-old, who served as the creative director of Halston, Rochas and Schiaparelli before launching his namesake ready-to-wear brand in 2019. I started to spend my summers there, digging into anything that felt and looked Swedish.

title: Lahainas Immigrants Weigh an Uncertain Future
description: It was a nice life, and by the sea.

title: Sofia Coppola and All the Sad Girls
description: For 25 years, Sofia Coppolas films have served as a stylistic manual for how to be sad, or at least disaffected, in our modern age.

title: The 2023 New York Times/New York Public Library Best Illustrated Childrens Books
description: The 10 winners of The New York Times/New York Public Library Best Illustrated Childrens Books Award are chosen each year by a rotating panel of three expert judges.

title: What Israelis Fear the World Does Not Understand
description: Earlier this week, we heard a Palestinian perspective on the conflict. Today, I wanted to have on an Israeli perspective.

title: Im a Pollster. Democrats Need Young Voters to Win in 2024.
description: Well before the latest Times/Siena poll raised concerns about Joe Bidens re-election prospects, John Della Volpe was sounding alarms. The Harvard Kennedy School pollster  who worked on Bidens 2020 campaign  first noticed a change in the way young voters were thinking about politics last spring. For months he has heard dissatisfaction with the two parties and increasing attraction to third party options from young voters in his town halls.

title: The Tunnels of Gaza
description: A maze of tunnels extends below the Gaza Strip, allowing Hamas fighters to stay out of sight and smuggle weapons and goods.

title: The Literary Lives of New York Citys Youth
description: In 1906, Anne Carroll Moore was anointed the first head of the Department of Work With Children at the New York Public Library. There she oversaw the creation of the Central Childrens Room at the newly built flagship on 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue, established story hours and opened the previously locked shelves to all children provided they agreed to sign a pledge that read: When I write my name in this book I promise to take good care of the books I use in the Library and at home, and to obey the rules of the Library. By 1913, one third of the titles borrowed from all branches of the N.Y.P.L. were childrens books. To celebrate this years Best Illustrated Childrens Books, we looked through archival photos of the librarys childrens reading rooms.

title: Man vs. Musk: A Whistleblower Creates Headaches for Tesla
description: A day after Lukasz Krupski put out a fire at a Tesla car delivery location in Norway, seriously burning his hands and preventing a disaster, he got an email from Elon Musk.

title: What I Believe as a Historian of Genocide
description: Israeli military operations have created an untenable humanitarian crisis, which will only worsen over time. But are Israels actions  as the nations opponents argue  verging on ethnic cleansing or, most explosively, genocide?

title: Welcome to Hochatown, the Town Created by Airbnb
description: The tiny town of Hochatown, on the shores of Broken Bow Lake in the southeast corner of Oklahoma, was created exactly one year ago. And its almost entirely thanks to Airbnb.

title: Gonorrhea Is Becoming Drug Resistant. Scientists Just Found a Solution.
description: A new antibiotic, the first to be developed in decades, can cure gonorrhea infections at least as effectively as the most powerful current treatment, a large clinical trial has found. The drug, zoliflodacin, is taken as a single dose, and it has not yet been approved for use in any country.

title: Debut Novels About Women Longing in Obsessive, Sometimes Uncanny Ways
description: Sheena Patels IM A FAN (Graywolf, 203 pp., paperback, $17) is an impolite novel about romantic obsession, set in a liberalized but inequitable sexual economy that rewards the white and rich. The unnamed narrator, a young brown woman living in London, spends much of the book online, fixating on the white, married and much older man I want to be with and the other women in his life. Imagining herself meeting one paramour in particular, she wonders, Would I tell her I know who all her friends are and I watch their stories too, would I tell her I screenshot the photos she takes of herself and study her face so intently sometimes I fear Ive picked up some facial expressions or tonal inflections from her?

title: Germanys Stifling of Pro-Palestinian Voices Pits Historical Guilt Against Free Speech
description: Since fleeing Syria a decade ago, Wafa Mustafa has spoken out for political prisoners at the United Nations, held vigils outside war crimes trials and chanted in solidarity with Iranians protesting their authoritarian government.

title: A Marine Veteran, 91, Takes Joy in Building Model Ships
description: Good morning. Its Friday, the federal holiday for Veterans Day. Well meet a 91-year-old Marine Corps veteran who builds model ships. Well also find out why Dr. Ruth Westheimer has just been named New Yorks loneliness ambassador.

title: The G.O.Ps Culture War Shtick Is Wearing Thin With Voters
description: The Republican Party has always leaned on culture war issues to win elections, but for the past three years, since Joe Biden won office in 2020, an aggressive and virulent form of culture war demagoguery has been at the center of Republican political strategy.

title: American Elections Are About Abortion Now
description: With two election cycles after the decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Womens Health Organization under our belts, it cannot be denied: Abortion rights are the dominant issue in American politics. And when supporters of abortion rights  a clear majority of Americans  see a connection between their votes and protecting what was once guaranteed by Roe v. Wade, they are more likely to vote.

title: Personalized A.I. Agents Are Here. Is the World Ready for Them?
description: You could think of the recent history of A.I. chatbots as having two distinct phases.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, Nov. 10, 2023
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: A selection of entertainment highlights this weekend, including a review of the Showtime series "The Curse."

title: 6 New Paperbacks to Read This Week
description: Recommended reading from the Book Review, including titles by John Edgar Wideman, Yasunari Kawabata, Allegra Goodman and more.

title: Liberal Donor Group Targets New York and California House Seats for 2024
description: The Democracy Alliance, a powerful network of major liberal donors, will prioritize winning back control of the House for Democrats next year by planning to pour funds into crucial races in New York and California.

title: How the T. Rex Built Up That Bone-Crushing Bite
description: If you have ever stood in the presence of a complete fossil of a Tyrannosaurus rex, there is no doubt it was the apex predator of its era. The adults were enormous, with giant skulls and banana-size serrated teeth. The strength of the bite of a full-grown T. rex has been the subject of numerous scientific studies, but mysteries endure about what led to this powerful chomp that ruled the end of the dinosaur era.

title: Hold That Thought! Heres Why Being Interrupted Is So Irritating.
description: My parents have been married for 60 years. At this point, theyve worked out most of their issues. But if my father interrupts my mother, her eyes grow unnaturally bright, and she rises up like a cobra.

title: Personalized GPTs Are Here, F.T.C. Chair Lina Khan on A.I. Competition, and Mayhem at Apefest
description: Warning: this episode contains some explicit language.

title: A Treasure May Be Off the Coast of Colombia, but Who Can Claim It?
description: When the San Jos made its final voyage from Seville, Spain, to the Americas in 1706, the Spanish galleon was considered to be one of the most complex machines ever built.

title: After Averting a Hotel Strike, Las Vegas Still Has a Lot of Work to Do
description: Debra Jefferies, a cocktail waitress at the Horseshoe Las Vegas, spent much of the week wondering whether she would be walking a picket line, as she did in 1984  the last time there was a major strike among hospitality workers in the city.

title: Israel Agrees to Short Pauses in Gaza Fighting, and More
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you havent already, download it here  available to Times news subscribers on iOS  and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: Your New Music Mixtape
description: Jon Pareles, chief pop music critic for The New York Times, brings you a playlist of five recently released songs worth checking out:

title: What Adidas Knew About Kanye
description: Warning: this episode contains some explicit language.

title: How Tropical Birds Took Over This European Capital, Bringing a Splash of Color
description: In the lively Brussels neighborhood of Flagey, you can be sure of two things: People will be lined up for fries at Frit Flagey, and pigeons will be nearby, pecking at scraps.

title: U.S. Seeks to Resume Military Dialogue With Beijing
description: President Bidens top military adviser has told China that the United States is open to resuming military-to-military communication that Beijing suspended last year to protest then-Speaker Nancy Pelosis visit to Taiwan.

title: Israels Ticking Clock
description: The invasion seemed imminent. In the hours after Hamas attacked Israel on Oct. 7, Benjamin Netanyahu appeared ready to send his troops storming into Gaza. Instead, he chose a different strategy.

title: Rebels Are Notching Key Wins Against the Military Junta in Myanmar
description: An alliance of rebel forces in war-torn Myanmar has taken several key towns from the countrys military regime in recent weeks, the most successful challenge to the junta that seized power in a coup in 2021 and the latest evidence of how overstretched the military has become.

title: The Weekender
A Buttermilk-Brined Chicken in Advance of the Big Bird
description: Good morning. Two weeks from today Thanksgiving will be a memory, so its definitely not too early to start your planning for the feast. Order your bird this weekend (birds, in my case). Sketch out a menu with the aid of our Thanksgiving recipe guide. Take an inventory of plates and platters, serving spoons, glasses, knives, forks and napkins. And consider the book of the rules.

title: Biden and Xi to Seek to Stabilize Relations in California Meeting
description: President Biden and President Xi Jinping of China plan to meet in California on Wednesday for a discussion that Mr. Bidens advisers say is meant to stabilize relations even as it features a host of topics on which the two fiercely competitive countries disagree.

title: What Ended the Market Rally
description: The S&P 500 was on its way to a ninth straight day of gains on Thursday when investors got hit by a double whammy: a lackluster auction for 30-year Treasury bonds and more hawkish words from Jay Powell, the Fed chair, that prompted a sell-off in stocks and bonds.

title: Thousands Wait at Ukraine Border After Polish Truckers Blockade It
description: Thousands of trucks were lined up at several border crossings between Ukraine and Poland on Friday, preventing goods from being delivered to Europe and causing traffic jams lasting several days as Polish truckers blocked checkpoints over what they said was unfair competition from their Ukrainian counterparts.

title: Prince Harry Can Proceed With a Lawsuit Against Daily Mail Publisher
description: Prince Harry and other celebrities can proceed with their case against The Daily Mails publisher, a British judge ruled on Friday, paving the way for a lengthy court battle over phone hacking and other alleged violations of privacy.

title: Mac Barnett Has Nothing to Talk About
description: Five new picture books all contemplate nothingness. From emptiness to absence to an intangible rhinoceros, we have a whole lot of nothing to discuss, so lets get to it.

title: Surviving the Holidays at Work When You Dread the Season
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location, or a request to remain anonymous. Letters may be edited.

title: Higher Contribution Limits Are Coming for 401(k) Retirement Plans
description: Those with enough means will be able to save more money in their workplace retirement accounts next year.

title: The Betting on the Presidential Election Has Begun
description: Financial journalists love Wall Street aphorisms. I use them whenever I can.

title: The Little Match Girl Lives to Tell the Tale
description: One might think Hans Christian Andersens The Little Match Girl, an 1845 tear-jerker about a poverty-stricken child who freezes to death one snowy New Years Eve, would be a hard sell for todays kids. But the sad tale and its author get a second chance in two new middle grade novels.

title: For Max Beckmann, Arts Ironist, Crisis and Rediscovery
description: Before the war (the First World War, I mean; with so many wars one can lose count), Max Beckmann was painting clean, traditionalist self-portraits and lush pictures of bathers by the sea. He was a neoconservative with no time for Matisse or Picasso, and certainly no interest in the coming of abstraction. Then, when the war broke out, the artist volunteered for the medical corps of the Imperial German Army. He got posted to Flanders, where he witnessed the murderous, meaningless second Battle of Ypres. He sketched the Belgian landscape, and the doctors and orderlies.

title: Britains Prisons Are Dangerously Close to Capacity
description: The prison system in England and Wales is dangerously close to capacity, with 98 percent of available spaces full, according to data released by Britains Ministry of Justice on Friday that experts said underscored an ongoing crisis within the criminal justice system.

title: Chris Christie to Travel to Israel
description: Chris Christie, the former governor of New Jersey who is running for president, will go to Israel on Sunday, pressing what he sees as his foreign policy advantage in the race and challenging the other Republicans seeking the White House nomination to join him.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Yossi Klein Halevi
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Yossi Klein Halevi. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: The hosts spent most of the week riffing on the third Republican debate, but also took time to discuss former President Trumps lead over President Biden in an early poll. Heres what they had to say.

title: A Grocery Chain Just Fired Its Self-Checkouts
description: When it comes to grocery shopping, there seem to be two kinds of people in this world: those who prefer self-checkout, and those who prefer interaction with a human.

title: Making a Murderer, David Fincher Style
description: Movie assassins tend to move through the world like chic land sharks: sleek, ruthless, undetectable until its too late. But the numerous quirks of the nameless lead portrayed by Michael Fassbender in David Finchers latest film, The Killer (streaming on Netflix) defy the genre stereotypes of a suave, soulless hit man. Instead, the screenwriter Andrew Kevin Walker, adapting from a French graphic novel series by Alexis Nolent, said via Zoom that he deliberately designed his bucket-hat-wearing, McMuffin-eating muse as the anti-James Bond, almost alien. He added, The fact that he doesnt care whether his drink is shaken or stirred makes sense for his character. We wanted him to hide in plain sight. Below, how to build an oddball executioner in seven easy steps.

title: The Curse Series Premiere Recap: The Cameras Are Rolling
description: Nathan Fielders career to this point has been defined by an obsession with the way people act when they are being filmed. In his Comedy Central series, Nathan for You, he came up with outlandish ideas to promote small businesses, often capturing the surreality of human behavior as he instituted his plans. He followed that up with The Rehearsal, an HBO show in which he tested the idea that one could rehearse for real life scenarios  confrontations with friends or even parenthood  and filmed the results.

title: Americas top diplomat says far too many Palestinians have been killed.
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said on Friday that far too many Palestinians have been killed in Gaza, in the latest indication that the Biden administration is growing increasingly concerned about the civilian death toll under Israels bombardment and ground invasion.

title: Overlooked No More: ngela Ruiz Robles, Inventor of an Early E-Reader
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times.

title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
description: Oh man, how to describe Guillaume Niclouxs profoundly despairing film. The Mist meets Yellowjackets? Close, but not sinister enough. Ill just say this: The movie crushed me.

title: Grammy Awards 2024: The Full List of Nominees
description: SZA is the top nominee for the 66th annual Grammy Awards with nine nods, all for her album SOS, which topped the Billboard 200 for 10 weeks.

title: Is This Hell? The Pilot Accused of Trying to Crash a Plane Tells His Story.
description: In the minutes before he boarded an Alaska Airlines flight home last month, Joseph Emerson, a pilot for the airline, texted his wife. He was eager to be home with their two young children and longing to be next to her. I just want to hold you, he wrote.

title: Three Stories of Pregnancy and Birth in Ukraine
description: One of the first sounds my son ever heard was an air siren. He is one of the lucky ones.

title: SZA, Barbie Songs and Young Women Lead 2024 Grammy Nominees
description: SZA, Taylor Swift, Olivia Rodrigo, the indie supergroup boygenius and the eclectic bandleader Jon Batiste are among the top nominees for the 66th annual Grammy Awards, leading a class of contenders dominated by young women.

title: The Big Number: 98%
description: Shares in the co-working company WeWork had already fallen precipitously before it filed for bankruptcy.

title: Megan Rapinoe, Emma Hayes and a Womens Soccer Crossroads
description: Emma Hayes first met Megan Rapinoe before she was Megan Rapinoe. Or, rather, just as she was becoming Megan Rapinoe. She was not yet a winner of two World Cups, not yet an Olympic champion, not yet captain of her country, not yet a powerful and urgent voice away from the field. Rapinoe was not even a professional soccer player back then, not quite.

title: Before World Leaders Arrive, San Francisco Races to Clean Up
description: San Francisco had the air this week of teenagers frantically cleaning up after a house party with their parents on the way home.

title: Hes Gone From Miami, to Celebrity, to Upending Greek Politics
description: Stefanos Kasselakis was virtually unknown in Greece just six months ago when he was a no-chance election candidate with Syriza, the countrys main opposition party.

title: Judge Puts Off Decision on Whether to Delay Trump Documents Trial
description: A federal judge on Friday put off until at least March the fraught and consequential decision of whether to delay the start of former President Donald J. Trumps trial on charges of illegally holding on to a trove of highly classified national security secrets after he left office.

title: A Debate Over the Value of the Humanities
description: To the Editor:

title: After Trump Testifies, Republicans Attack Judge in Civil Fraud Trial
description: Representative Elise Stefanik, a member of the House Republican leadership and an ally of former President Donald J. Trump, filed an ethics complaint Friday attacking the judge presiding over Mr. Trumps civil fraud trial, the latest salvo in a right-wing war against the case.

title: Curtains Down, Bottoms Up: When the Show Ends, the Nights Just Getting Started
description: A funny thing happened at Dead Letter No. 9, a new performance space in Brooklyn. It was just after 10 p.m. on a Saturday in late October. The evenings show had finished, but the audience wouldnt leave  crowding instead into the adjoining bar for cocktails, mocktails and flatbreads.

title: Grammy Snubs and Surprises: boygenius Thrives, Country and Rap Wither
description: Young women from across genres  along with the Recording Academys favorite polymath spoiler Jon Batiste  reigned atop the nominations on Friday for the 66th annual Grammy Awards, to be held Feb. 4 in Los Angeles.

title: Alarmed by Off-Year Losses, Mainstream Republicans Balk at Abortion Curbs
description: Two days after Republicans across the country suffered a drubbing, dragged down by their opposition to abortion rights in the off-year elections, G.O.P. leaders on Capitol Hill appeared not to have gotten the memo.

title: Davide Renne, Moschino Creative Director, Dead at 46
description: Davide Renne, the Italian fashion designer and former head of womens wear at Gucci, died on Friday in Milan, Italy, nine days after becoming the creative director of Moschino. He was 46.

title: Review: With Premieres, an Orchestra Keeps Facing Forward
description: Pity the American composer interested in writing orchestral music. Unless your last name is Glass, Reich or Adams, opportunities are destined to come few and far between.

title: Swiss Museum in Financial Straits Sells Three Czannes for $53 Million
description: Three paintings by Paul Czanne that a Swiss museum foundation said it had to sell to ward off insolvency fetched $52.5 million, with buyers fees, at a Christies auction in New York last night.

title: Rice Krispie Treats in a Plastic Tube, and Other Dances
description: I should try and solve some problems, the artist Michelle Ellsworth said on Thursday at the Chocolate Factory Theater in Queens, as five dancers buzzed around a hulking wooden contraption that looked like a cross between a kitchen, a playground structure and an MRI machine.

title: With Manchin Out, Democrats Path to Holding the Senate Is Narrow
description: Senator Joe Manchin III said he decided to forgo re-election because hed accomplished all his goals. But for the Democrats hes leaving behind in Washington, the work to hold the partys already slim Senate majority is just beginning.

title: The Success of Rebecca Yarros and Barbra Streisands Mammoth Memoir
description: Its dueling Alexandras on this weeks Book Review podcast.

title: Antisemitic Hate Crimes Soar in New York City
description: The police in New York City are searching for vandals who scrawled Hamas and antisemitic graffiti on several Upper East Side apartment buildings last month amid a sharp increase in hate crimes directed at the Jewish community.

title: 12 Grammy Nominees You Need to Hear
description: Im Jon Pareles, sitting in for Lindsay this week because while shes on vacation, we couldnt let the Grammy Awards nominations go by without a playlist.

title: Marina Cicogna, Italys First Major Female Film Producer, Dies at 89
description: Marina Cicogna, an Italian countess who became her countrys first major female film producer, guiding to the screen celebrated films by Pier Paolo Pasolini, Franco Zeffirelli and Elio Petri, died on Nov. 4 at her home in Rome. She was 89.

title: TikTokers Mourn the Shutdown of Omegle
description: Romain Degrave first discovered Omegle three years ago, when he was still in high school. Since its inception in 2009, the online service, which randomly pairs strangers for anonymous video chat sessions, had been connecting users across the globe for moments of discovery, whimsy, cross-cultural exchange and political debate.

title: Suspect in Jan. 6 Capitol Attack Surrenders After Two-Day Manhunt
description: Gregory Yetman, a former member of the New Jersey Army National Guard, surrendered to the authorities on Friday on charges related to the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol, concluding an intense manhunt.

title: After a Scare, Croatian Authorities Declare Coca-Cola Products Safe
description: Coca-Cola brand beverages have been deemed safe to drink in Croatia, government officials said on Thursday, following illnesses in the country that had raised fears that the bottles had been contaminated.

title: Victoria Mont on Her 7 Grammy Nods (and One for Her Toddler)
description: On the morning of this years Grammy Award nominations, Victoria Mont, the pop and R&B singer and songwriter, had the champagne ready no matter what.

title: I Earn Much More Than My Husband. Shouldnt He Get a Better Job?
description: Ive been happily married for more than 10 years, and my husband is wonderful  hes my best friend and a great partner in almost every respect. The only major issue is that, while I earn a relatively modest salary, I still make more than 80 percent of the household income and have done so for almost all of our time together, though Ive never consented to this. He has a small business that he has never tried to properly expand, and because of where we live, he can only work remotely, which is not easy.

title: Blinken Stresses Need for Humanitarian Aid for Gaza
description: During a trip to New Delhi, Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said that far too many Palestinians have been killed in Gaza.

title: Flashback: Your Weekly History Quiz, November 12, 2023
description: Can you sort 8 historical events?

title: F.B.I. Seizes Eric Adamss Phones as Campaign Investigation Intensifies
description: F.B.I. agents seized Mayor Eric Adamss electronic devices early this week in what appeared to be a dramatic escalation of a criminal inquiry into whether his 2021 campaign conspired with the Turkish government and others to funnel money into its coffers.

title: Pittsburgh Museum Apologizes for Handling of Islamic Art Show
description: The head of the Frick Pittsburgh apologized Thursday for the way she handled the postponement of an exhibition of Islamic art, which had been scheduled to open this month before museum leaders decided to delay it because of the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Taylor Swift Takes Her Eras Tour Global, Shaking Argentina
description: On May 31, Florencia Romeo slept in a tent outside Argentinas largest stadium with her girlfriend and her sister. They had heard rumors that Taylor Swift might be coming to Buenos Aires, and they wanted to be first in line.

title: Rabbis From Across the Globe Flock to New York for Prayer  and Hope
description: The rabbis came from Israel and Ukraine, from Azerbaijan and France, from Thailand and farther still, as thousands of Jews filed into a graveyard in Queens under a sea of black hats.

title: Conservative Thinkers Didnt Create Trumpism
description: There is a story that professional ideamongers like to tell about political history that gives pride of place to their own work. Its a story that usually begins with some small tribe of writers or intellectuals who come up with a set of theories that describe the world in a new way. Marginal at first, their arguments eventually break out into the wider sphere of campaigns and candidates, capturing one or the other major political coalition and finally emerging as the consensus of an age.

title: The Egyptian Rapper Wegz Wants to Take Arabic Hip-Hop Worldwide
description: On the ninth stop of his first world tour, the Egyptian rapper Wegz finished soundcheck at the Howard Theater in Washington, D.C., and relaxed on a worn black leather couch wearing a gray Carhartt fleece jacket and cream New Balance 990 sneakers. In his unflashy attire, passers-by might not have recognized one of the biggest artists in the emerging Arabic music scene calmly awaiting his set time.

title: Yellen Says U.S. Wants Healthy Economic Ties With China
description: The United States and China agreed on Friday that they would not seek to decouple their economies and pledged to take steps to improve the business climates for American and Chinese companies operating in both countries, a significant step toward thawing relations between the worlds largest economies.

title: Gaza City Hospitals Are Caught in Deadly Crossfire
description: Gaza Citys hospitals were increasingly under siege on Friday, with hundreds of seriously ill and wounded patients and thousands of displaced people stranded on hospital grounds as intense, close-quarters combat between Israeli troops and Hamas fighters raged around them.

title: Street Battles Rage in Gaza City Ruins, as Residents Flee on Foot
description: Israeli soldiers and armored vehicles have engaged Hamas fighters in days of running gun battles in Gaza City, fighting through rubble-filled streets and blasted-out buildings for control of the Gaza Strips largest urban center and the militants main stronghold.

title: Lara Parker, a Memorable Witch on Dark Shadows, Dies at 84
description: Lara Parker, who found small-screen fame in the 1960s and 70s as a beguiling and vengeful witch on the popular Gothic soap opera Dark Shadows, died on Oct. 12 at her home in Topanga, Calif. She was 84.

title: PinkPantheress Leaves the Bedroom for the Wider Pop World
description: The British producer, singer and songwriter PinkPantheress, 22, emerged during the pandemic with a hushed and nostalgic play on dance music, turning canny samples from the club and beyond into intimate, original bedroom pop.

title: Moodys Changes U.S. Credit Outlook to Negative
description: The outlook on the credit rating of the United States was changed  to negative from stable on Friday by the ratings firm Moodys, which pointed to the nations worsening fiscal position and political polarization as long-term concerns for Americas economy.

title: Pastor Indicted With Trump in Georgia Asks Evangelical Supporters for Help
description: The Rev. Stephen C. Lee is one of the lesser-known figures indicted with former President Donald J. Trump in Fulton County, Ga., on charges of unlawfully conspiring to keep Mr. Trump in power after the 2020 election.

title: boygenius on Its First Grammy Nominations and Keeping Rock Fun
description: For boygenius, the indie-rock supergroup with a penchant for neckties and introspective songs, this fall has held the kind of firsts that prove a rock band has turned into a phenomenon: its first arena show at a Madison Square Garden packed with fans chanting every lyric, its first performance at the Hollywood Bowl, and soon, its first feature on Saturday Night Live.

title: Harvard, Columbia and Penn Pledge to Fight Antisemitism on Campus
description: Over the last month, university presidents have been battered by a vocal cohort of alumni and faculty members who have accused them of not being strong enough in their denunciations of antisemitism in the wake of the Hamas attack on Israel.

title: Family in Take Care of Maya Documentary Is Awarded $261 Million
description: A jury in Florida ordered a hospital to pay $261 million in damages to a family after the parents were accused of abusing their daughter and barred from seeing her during months of treatment. Their story was chronicled in the Netflix documentary Take Care of Maya.

title: Hollywood Actors to Start Voting Tuesday on Contract Deal
description: The union that represents movie and television actors said on Friday that its 76-member national board had voted with 86 percent support to send a tentative contract with studios to members for ratification.

title: Florida-Bound Plane Had Missing and Damaged Windowpanes After Takeoff
description: A plane flying from London to Orlando, Fla., last month was forced to turn around because some windowpanes were missing or damaged, startling passengers who had reported hearing roaring sounds inside the cabin, the authorities said.

title: These babies, these ladies, these old people: Macron mourns civilian deaths and urges an Israeli cease-fire.
description: Against a backdrop of mounting international outrage over civilian casualties as Israel wages war on Hamas, President Emmanuel Macron of France on Friday called on Israel to stop the killing in Gaza.

title: Storm Warning
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This puzzle has a little something for the neophyte, and a little something for the grizzled vet. Anyone interested in a juicy solve thats vibrant and likely to build your confidence rather than tear it to shreds? Well, walk this way.

title: Quotation of the Day: In Switzerland, Buying a Home Is Out of Reach
description: Its beyond luxury. Two kids, a house, a garden, two cars  I dont know anybody who has that.

title: Louisiana Must Finalize New Voting Map by January, Federal Appeals Court Says
description: A federal appeals court on Friday agreed with a lower-court ruling that Louisianas latest congressional map very likely violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting the power of Black voters, and ordered the state to finalize a new map by Jan. 15.

title: Corrections: Nov. 11, 2023
description: An article on Page 14 this weekend about the U.S. Space Force misspelled the surname of a member of the U.S. Space Force. He is Lt. Col. Galen Thorp, not Thorpe.

title: No, 11,200 Climate Refugees Arent Heading to Australia
description: The Pacific island nation of Tuvalu once comprised 11 islands. It is now down to nine flecks of land totaling less than 10 square miles, which, like their lost siblings before them, risk gradually being eaten away by the rising tides of the worlds warming oceans.

title: Life in Gaza City: Privation, Rationing and Desperate Fear
description: For years, Mohammad Matar worked on constructing pipelines that moved water across the Gaza Strip  from northern Beit Lahia to southern Rafah. Now, he can barely get access to water himself.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Portraits From a Photo Shoot Far, Far Away
description: While some people look up into the night sky and wonder whats out there, Guy Pignolet, an 81-year-old space educator, can be confident that he will one day be part of the answer. After he dies, Mr. Pignolet plans to have his ashes launched into space.

title: When Aviation Was More Than the News
description: In charting the flight of the battery-powered CX300 aircraft recently, The New York Times was back where it has spent a lot of time over the last 120 years: in the clouds.

title: Two Young Democratic Stars Collide Over Israel and Their Partys Future
description: They are among the brightest political stars rising from New York. They were born just months apart, 40 years after the founding of Israel.

title: How a Friend of the High Line Spends His Sundays
description: Alan van Capelle spends a lot of time trying to foster equality and a sense of belonging as the executive director of Friends of the High Line, the nonprofit that oversees the parks operations.

title: They Arrived Homeless. Now Theyre Helping Others Make New York Home.
description: The migrants started lining up by dawn. After trekking to New York from across Latin America, young people and families had made their way to an elementary school on the Lower East Side to be greeted, in Spanish, by immigrants who had come before them.

title: Mint, the Budgeting App, Is Going Away. Here Are Some Alternatives.
description: The demise of Mint, the beloved budgeting app, has caused its millions of users to consider alternatives. That makes it as good a time as any for everyone to consider a money management tool.

title: Major Pro-Palestinian March Staged in London as Police Ramp Up Security
description: Hundreds of thousands of people marched through central London in a huge pro-Palestinian demonstration on Saturday, a tense day in which the police battled with a small right-wing group to keep order on some city streets.

title: How a Decaying Warship Beached on a Tiny Shoal Provoked Chinas Ire
description: For more than two decades, it has been an unlikely flashpoint in the South China Sea: a rusty, World War II-era ship beached on a tiny reef that has become a symbol of Philippine resistance against Beijing.

title: Chapter 4: The Wedding
description: For Indian families, a modest wedding is an oxymoron. No matter how meager a households earnings, no expense can be spared. It was no different for Arti Kumaris parents, despite their limited means as an NGO worker and a subsistence farmer.

title: Three Days That Changed the Thinking About Black Womens Health
description: On June 24, 1983, Byllye Avery welcomed busloads of Black women to the campus of Spelman College in Atlanta. She was in a state of disbelief. The women had traveled from Mississippi, New York, Pennsylvania  even as far away as California  for a three-day event billed as the First National Conference on Black Womens Health Issues.

title: Inside Facebooks Dangerous Battle Between Integrity and Engagement
description: In a welcome departure from the subgenre of stories about Facebook, Jeff Horwitzs Broken Code doesnt open in a Harvard dorm room. Expanding on the revelations of his blockbuster Facebook Files series of articles in The Wall Street Journal, the book focuses squarely on the past decade. It begins when Facebook is already a global behemoth with a user count in the billions  and a company ethos that has yet to account for its capacity to effect enormous social and political change.

title: One Year in the Infuriating and Humiliating Search for a Job in South Africa
description: This is a part of a series on how Africas youth boom is changing the continent, and beyond.

title: Florida Man Chases Poachers
description: The journalist Rebecca Renner still lives in Central Florida, where she grew up playing in a swamp near her house and had her first close encounter with a full-size alligator at age 7.

title: The Members of This Manuscripts Club Were Obsessed With Medieval Books
description: A harrowing passage in Hilary Mantels Wolf Hall describes the ransacking of Cardinal Wolseys house in 1529 by the Dukes of Norfolk and Sussex, a pillage that included recklessly emptying Wolseys chests of their medieval books: The texts are heavy to hold in the arms, and awkward as if they breathed; their pages are made of slunk vellum from stillborn calves, reveined by the illuminator in tints of lapis and leaf-green.

title: A Gamy Picaresque for the Age of the Notes-App Apology
description: A bucket of moldy jam stored in the walk-in storage closet of an L.A. cafe; famous men masturbating in front of young women; misappropriated campaign funds: Such real-life cancellation plots provide the unspoken backdrop to Lexi Freimans angular, careening latest, The Book of Ayn, which charts a writers undoing after she publishes an opioid crisis satire, written from a rent-free pied--terre with a view of the Empire State Building. This is a gamy picaresque for the age of the notes-app apology: a cutting novel of ego and its death, Freudian yearning, Randian Hollywood, scatological epiphany and the vileness of the pursuit of a career in letters.

title: Doechii Stays Balanced With 24-Hour Spas and a Good Girls Night
description: Before the 25-year-old rapper and singer Doechii began opening for Doja Cat on the Scarlet Tour last month, she had a high-profile warm-up gig in Los Angeles, performing before Beyonc on her Renaissance World Tour.

title: Hear the Dance: Audio Description Comes of Age
description: The dancer Krishna Washburn remembers attending a performance years ago by a well-known modern dance company at a large New York City theater. Washburn, who is blind, opted to experience the show with audio description: in this case, a track that narrated the dance as it was happening, delivered through a headset.

title: They Wanted to Get Sober. They Got a Nightmare Instead.
description: The white vans were the first thing people noticed.

title: A Black Womans Rise in Architecture Shows How Far Is Left to Go
description: When Kimberly Dowdell becomes president of the American Institute of Architects next month, her ascent will be noteworthy. Ms. Dowdell, an architect in a profession that is overwhelmingly white and male, is a Black woman, the first to fill the post in the groups 166-year history.

title: How Millions of Borrowers Got $127 Billion in Student Loans Canceled
description: When the Supreme Court struck down President Bidens $400 billion plan to forgive up to $20,000 in federal student loan debt for 43 million borrowers, the prospect of substantive debt relief appeared to vanish.

title: Overwhelmed With Writing Your Vows? A Professional Wordsmith Could Help.
description: The 200 guests at Rachel Mumfords backyard wedding in Malibu, Calif., were suddenly on their feet, clapping, giving her an unexpected ovation. Forty-eight hours earlier, she probably wouldnt have felt as calm or confident.

title: My Landlord Disappeared With the Security Deposit. How Do I Get It Back?
description: Q: After selling our apartment in Brooklyn, my family and I rented for 14 months from an owner in our building. We thought we had a good relationship with her and took excellent care of the apartment. But when we moved out, she returned only a small portion of our security deposit and said she was withholding the rest while she assessed some questionable issues. All were either her responsibility, like changing the locks, or the buildings. She never told us where the security deposit was being held, nor produced an invoice showing how the deposit was used to address any issues. Weve heard nothing since August, despite our attempts to reach her. We are now living overseas and are out thousands of dollars. What can we do?

title: They Left Gaza to Work in Israel. Now Theyre Stranded.
description: Thousands of workers from Gaza have been trapped in the West Bank since the Hamas attacks on October 7. Their Israeli work permits have been canceled, and theyre deeply worried about their families back home.

title: Sweeping Raids, Giant Camps and Mass Deportations: Inside Trumps 2025 Immigration Plans
description: Former President Donald J. Trump is planning an extreme expansion of his first-term crackdown on immigration if he returns to power in 2025  including preparing to round up undocumented people already in the United States on a vast scale and detain them in sprawling camps while they wait to be expelled.

title: Ohio Voted to Protect Abortion Rights. Could Florida Be Next?
description: Since the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade last year, campaigns to protect abortion rights have galvanized voters in state after state. It has become Democrats most successful issue ahead of an uncertain 2024 election cycle  and their biggest hope, especially after voters in Ohio approved on Tuesday a measure to enshrine abortion rights in the State Constitution.

title: They Ran Into a Bomb Shelter for Safety. Instead, They Were Slaughtered.
description: Nearly 30 young people took refuge inside a grimy bunker on the morning of Oct. 7, hoping the reinforced-concrete shelter near the border with Gaza would fulfill its promise of protection.

title: Russia Glorifies Its World War II Dead. He Tries to Give Them Decent Burials.
description: The skeletons are never far away from Konstantin A. Dobrovolsky. Sometimes he sleeps above them in a tiny olive-green trailer in the woods. The people they might once have been appear in his dreams.

title: Top 10 Hardest and Easiest Spelling Bee Words, Nov. 4-10
description: Note: If you plan to play Spelling Bees Past Puzzles from the last week, this list may contain spoilers.

title: The Only People Who Understand What a Caregiver Goes Through
description: On Thursday mornings, Julia Sadtler and Debora Dunbar log onto Zoom to talk about caring for their husbands with Alzheimers disease, in hourlong conversations that are usually informative, sometimes emotional and always supportive.

title: For Both Trudeau and Biden, Polls Suggest an Uphill Political Path
description: When Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and President Biden next meet, they will have something to commiserate over: their dismal standings in polls.

title: Our Merch, Ourselves
description: If you want to recreate the 1960s winged eyeliner that Cailee Spaeny wears in Priscilla, youll have to do so without the aid of the limited-edition makeup kit produced by the films studio, A24.
